Reviews.Title: “Wow! An authentic and comfortable Amsterdam experience.”
Reviews.Author: BigDtravlr
Reviews.Content: I can't imagine staying anywhere else in Amsterdam. The Design Room was large, and the bed was perfect. Rachel and Pepijn gave us excellent information and helped us whenever we needed guidance. We loved the view of the canal. They provide a noise machine, and we didn't notice noise when we slept. The church bells and sea gulls added to the flavor of the city's energy vibe. We walked to all the major attractions and enjoyed the minibar snacks each day. We were so full from breakfast that we couldn't even eat lunch most days. Be sure to get a museum pass to avoid lines. We managed to walk right into the Anne Frank house late one evening even though the lines had been long all day. Bring an umbrella and rain coat; the weather changes by the minute here.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Fantisy
Reviews.Content: From start to finish the staff helped us get acquainted with the city, and made wonderful recommendations based on our personal travel style and preferences. The rooms were large by European standards. The room was clean and well-appointed, and the views of the canal (2 windows!) were very nice and relaxing. We won't stay anywhere else now...this really was an unexpected treat. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay In Amsterdam city center”
Reviews.Author: JBarker34
Reviews.Content: My twenty year-old daughter and I stayed at this charming inn in Amsterdam. The breakfast was included and made fresh to order. The rooms were clean and comfortable and service pleasant and efficient. The extra touches like the snacks and drinks in the room and free wifi were appreciated. Best of all is the location. Close to major historic attractions and the fun of the local pubs and clubs that surround the red light district. We recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: travelgrl00
Reviews.Content: This hotel made our stay in Amsterdam such an incredible one. My husband and I stayed on the second floor canal view room, the Rembrandt room. The room is on the small side, but has everything you need. A comfortable bed, a mini bar with free water, drinks, beer, snacks, and they restock it! There is an awesome coffee maker in the room and it is just great to wake up and have an espresso while getting ready. The room is decorated very well, with some prints of rembrandts paintings, a small flat screen tv, and sitting area by the window with a vase with lovely tulips/flowers. The bathroom shower is great, good pressure. They supply nice shower gel and hand soap, although do not supply shampoo. The canal view is great! We were so pleased with this hotel. It was located on the end of the canal so it was less busy and not too noisy at night. The room did come with a white noise machine. The stairs are steep and narrow, as are all canal house stairs, but the owners were nice and brought our suitcases up for us. We arrived very early in the morning, so left our bags with them, and then did a little exploring nearby and came back at 10am and were able to get up to our room earlier than expected. The hotel is very close by to central station, and was not a problem walking there with our luggage, its about a 10 minute walk be we left the station on the wrong side and it took us longer as we had to walk around. Be sure to have a map handy! There are so many cafes, restaurants and coffee shops nearby. This is the best location! We walked everywhere. Its about a 25 minute walk to the museum area, but very close to the Redlight and Dam square. Don't be scared of the Red light district, there are some great bars and cafes, and I never felt unsafe here. If you walk left out of the hotel there is an outdoor market, and lots of cafes with outdoor seating about a block or 2 away. We spent a lot of time having a cappuccino in the sun while watching the market people here, its very nice! Breakfast here is superb! Breads with jams, jellies and spreads, musile ceral, granola, yogurt, fruit, croissants, and they will cook you up some eggs and bacon. You also get a platter of 3 cheeses and a dish of sliced meat and a cappuccino! What a great start to the day! I highly recommend this hotel! I can't wait to return! Thanks Rachel and Pijpin :)

Reviews.Title: “Super Comfortable Beds and Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Judy5464
Reviews.Content: We had the most relaxing few days in Amsterdam because of this B&B. The room was very clean, cute and comfortable. If anything, it was a chore to get out of bed because they were so comfortable. We had a canal side room on the second floor and it was a bit noisier on the Friday we stayed but we headed in very early...most visitors to Amsterdam might still be out and about. Other days you could hear these melodic bells in the evening and morning...not disturbing, but beautiful. Internet was robust and all the other amenities were spot on (snacks, drinks, etc.). Breakfast was perfectly hosted by friendly staff and delicious--from fresh squeezed orange juice to eggs/bacon. The location was incredible as it was across from New Market and close to so many incredible restaurants and sites. We walked everywhere. The hosts were perfectly hospitable and my next trip to Amsterdam centers completely around whether there is availability at this home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful canal side B&B, I can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: Lauren D
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner are in our twenties and it was our first time staying at the Misc. and therefore we didn't know what to expect. Before our stay the owners emailed us several times to keep us updated about our reservation and to make sure we got the room we wanted. When we arrived, I was so pleasantly surprised, it has such a cosy atmosphere - especially with the addition of Rue, the cat who sat drinking his water from a martini glass on the bar! The room was lovely, with a mini fridge that was replenished for free everyday. The view on to the canal was beautiful and peaceful, I was never concious of any noise from the street and I slept well! The whole place is very stylish and I was overwhelmed by the breakfast! There was no rush to have it at a ridiculously early hour, and there was such a lovely range of things to eat- from fresh bread and jams, to ham and cheese, muesli, yoghurts, and even an option of bacon and eggs cooked up if you wanted them! It really set us up for the day. The location is very good, right in the centre! Very close to the railway station, the shops and the restaurants. The staff were lovely, offering us an umbrella when it as raining out side - amongst other things. I really want to stay again! I can't wait to book my next trip to Amsterdam! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Homy little B&B in city centre”
Reviews.Author: Genger
Reviews.Content: I got 3 emails from the owner BEFORE staying in their hotel. 1 confirmation, then i wrote back asking about parking facility, they gave a extensive email answer regarding the whole transport system in Amsterdam, and at last they sent me a re-confirmation email about my reservation. This gesture let me feel their warm welcome before going to Amsterdam. Rachel greeted us with big smile, and the hudsome black lad helped us with the luggage (sorry didn't catch his name). We stayed in the designer room, 1st floor, canel view. 2 singles push together, about 1.6m wide, not perfect, but ok. The room is not big, simple-designed. A squished but lovely shower room with basin, and a seperate toilet. The radiator works fine (amsterdam was -10 degree when we were there!). No A.C, don't know if the summer gets hot... The free mini bar is abslutely great! 2 mini cokes+2 light coke+2 fanta 2 apple juice+2 orange juice, 2 BEERï¼� 1 bag of crisps, 1 bag cinnamon rolls. All FREEï¼� The Nespresso machine is a nice upgrade from a kettle where most hotel put as "coffee/tea making facility" several sorts of tea bags, 6 capsules of coffee. The stairs is steep indeed, not unusal in the country. Breakfast serves until 12, which is really good for late people like us :) We had scremble eggs and bacon, nice! Location is perfect, close to the red light district, the Dam, etc, but it's a relatively quiet neiborghood. Will recommend this place to everyone! The service and location rule all!

Reviews.Title: “Canal House”
Reviews.Author: Viajero Del Mundo
Reviews.Content: We had a really wonderful experience staying here. Lovely canal house with really steep narrow stairs (thank goodness we didn't have to lug our luggage up those stairs). Loved the location, centrally for the main attractions and only a few minutes walk from the railway station. It is right next to Chinatown and Red Light District but we found it quite safe and walked everywhere. Room has all the amenities, coffee, tea, and a small fridge stocked with Heineken, pop and goodies (chips, chocolate bars). This was lovely after a day of tramping around town. Breakfast was wonderful as were the hosts, Rachel and Pepjin.

Reviews.Title: “Another fabulous stay at Misceatdrinksleep!”
Reviews.Author: Jools S
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay and it was just as good as we remembered - the only thing missing was beautiful Prue the cat (bless). We stayed in the Wonders room (Design room last time). Both rooms were very comfortable and stocked with goodies. Pepjin's restaurant recommendations were 1st class and Rachel's GlÃ¼hwein was a taste sensation! We'll be back...Jools and Col

Reviews.Title: “All The Reviews Promised”
Reviews.Author: TerryNewZealand
Reviews.Content: We and friends had 2 Canal View Rooms in this canal house located very centrally for the main attractions and only a few minutes walk from the railway station. If you like hotel accommodation with long corridors and cells to left and right, this hotel is not for you. If character is what you are wanting this is it. Character and comfort, for the rooms are comfortable, clean, spacious and tastefully decorated in a modern style. Breakfast is continental plus eggs and bacon nicely cooked by Gabriel which set us up well for days of walking the city. We enjoyed pre dinner drinks in the well stocked bar which enabled us to get to know Rachel and Pepijn and to get their advice on what to do in the city, how to get there and where to have dinner. Spending time with them was much more informative than the guide books. We loved our time in Amsterdam not least because we looked forward to returning to misc eatdrinksleep after our day's touring for a drink and snack from the refrigerator which - unusually - were included in the tariff.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic place !!”
Reviews.Author: JjJbabcock
Reviews.Content: I knew from the moment I stepped in the door and was greeted by a smiling Rachel that staying here would be like a sleepover at a best friend's house :-). The ambience is warm, clean, well maintained and every small detail is provided for you. From the impeccable service and care to the unique and very comfortable rooms... Everything was PERFECT! After a long week in Brussels in sterile larger hotels, this was exactly what I needed. Absolutely wonderful place!

Reviews.Title: “Just Great !”
Reviews.Author: sareldlh
Reviews.Content: I just returned to the states after spending 5 nights at this delightful hotel. It is so convenient to everything in Amsterdam and is also right on a canal. The actual hotel is so warm and inviting.That is due to the owners Rachel and Pepjin who are so helpful and accommodating.Their friendliness and spot on recommendations for dining,shopping, etc just added to our enjoyment. We had the Design room and we loved it !The breakfasts prepared by Gabriel were delicious and prepared us for a full day exploring the city. If you want to feel part of the local scene and not just a tourist-stay here. We will be back..!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and nice”
Reviews.Author: Hilde-Beate
Reviews.Content: Nice small hotell. Everything was very good. :) Great location. Friendly staff. Good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam Experience”
Reviews.Author: weemsair
Reviews.Content: We stayed at several hotels in Amsterdam and this small one was the best. The room was great. The best thing about room was the bed, It was like sleeping on a cloud. The coffee-hot cocoa machine was great as well, Oh and did I mention the free snacks in room and excellent breakfast. When we return to Amsterdam in March we will definately stay there again. Rachel is great!

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Blellum
Reviews.Content: I have to echo the majority of the reviewers here. The hotel is very well placed - you can walk to almost anywhere from the location, and indeed we did. The tips for places to eat and drink from Rachel were excellent - do try the "brown bar" across the canal - good food there too. The room was clean, tidy and quiet - we stayed in a room overlooking the garden. Yes, the Red Light District is close, but if you travel to Amsterdam you should know what is there - that said, we never needed to walk through it. I can highly recommend this hotel, and I will be staying here again if I get back to Amsterdam soon.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky luxury in a very central location”
Reviews.Author: Bennet S
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel (6 rooms) in a very central location. Rachel and Pepijn made us feel very welcome and recommended areas to take the bikes we hired. The red light district is very close, but that is the nature of Amsterdam so shouldn't put you off. Superb breakfast, inventively decorated rooms (we had the 'Africa' room on the canal side which we loved), and all round we couldn't have asked for anything more.

Reviews.Title: “What a location”
Reviews.Author: MSPetersen
Reviews.Content: A very special hotel with a very special location. It is located more or less directly on the channels of Amsterdam. An furthermore in the red light district. The neighboorhood isnÂ´t dangerous but you will of course have to be careful. The hotel is nice, the rooms arenÂ´t big but they works. The staff is nice and try to help.

Reviews.Title: “What a find: highly recommended (unless you don't like stairs)”
Reviews.Author: NootsOnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: Beautiful little hotel, attention to detail is impressive, hosts are friendly and accommodating, superb location. Little staircases can be a bit of a trial but it's worth it. I'd defo stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Canal House in Amsterdam! A Jewel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dunlinbird
Reviews.Content: We loved our visit at misc eatdrinksleep! Rachel was wonderful about helping us find our way around the city and directing us to the museums and to the best seafood restaurants! Our room was on the top floor and had a great view of the canal. Very comfortable bed and the first comfortable pillows in years! Loved the luscious liquid bath and hand soaps - cedar and orange - ginger scented! The breakfasts were delightful - wonderful breads, jams, yogurt and hot food, too. Oh, and the latte was a real treat in the mornings! Wi-Fi was an added bonus which made it great to be able to access email from our room! Even though the steps were very steep and I am an older person, I really didn't have a major problem getting up and down to the room. The staff carried the luggage and did all the hard work for us! Great place to stay and we will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay In Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Tracy B
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best accommodation we have stayed in Amsterdam (after 12 trips)...We were lucky to be on the first level, and had a nice large room with a beautiful view of the canal..Had a delicious breakfast every morning and enjoyed conversation with the owner's Rachel and Pepijn whom were great hosts and went out of there way to make our stay what it was. Was also happy to have free wi-fi to stay in touch with family and friends...Thanks so much and look forward to our next stay :) And we were so lucky to have a week of over 20 degrees celsius with barely a cloud in the sky it was an amazing holiday!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: mlt_trvlz
Reviews.Content: i agree with all the reviews so far. this place is a real jewel. its location is perfect since its next to the university, chinatown and red light district. hence the atmosphere is very vibrant. its close to many of the attractions and its only 20mins away by walk from the extemities of amsterdam. getting to the hotel with heavy luggages might be putting off since the cobbled stones dont aid you when carrying luggages and you might risk damaging your suitcase. breakfast is very good especially the capuccino. the room was very clean and we really appreciated the nespresso machine and free mini bar. the hosts are very nice and discrete. if i would reccomend this hotel to any one. its great!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Inveroran
Reviews.Content: Plenty has been said before and most of it is true. It's very small and getting up the stairs would be challenging for those with movement difficulties. Everything else is great. Our room was quite large and quiet (at the back). The breakfast was good and plenty of it if you wanted. The journey to the hotel from the station was fraught as we had to drag our cases along a very busy street. However the hotel is in a good position with the main museums 10 minutes away, plenty of restarants beside the hotel and all the 'facilities' of the red light area nearby. I would certainly recommend people stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and very friendly”
Reviews.Author: L1ttlest_h0b0
Reviews.Content: This is a very retrospective review. We were here during the ashcloud in 2010. We loved this hotel, stayed in the Rembrandt room overlooking the canal. It was very well equipped including complementary drinks and snacks. The location was ideal ofr exploring Amsterdam with lots of good bars and eateies near by. Breakfasts were good and a very friendly affair Whilst trying to get home was very difficult due to the lack of air travel we were helped out frequently and allowed to stay on at reduced rates until we managed to get home. I suspect this was the only hotel in Amsterdam to reduce it's prices to make life easier for stranded travellers. Would defintiely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Pamela W
Reviews.Content: Misc eatdrinksleep is a small hotel/bed and breakfast right in the heart of the city center in Amsterdam. The location is fantastic...a few blocks from the Red Light District, China Town, the train station, and so much more. I visited Amsterdam immediately after a 25-day business trip to Tanzania. I was so tired and this wonderful hotel and its even more wonderful hosts (Rachel and Pipijn) helped restore my energy. A girlfriend met me in Amsterdam, and noticing that we were two singles traveling together, Rachel and Pipijn upgraded us to a larger canal room free of charge! The African room was spacious, very well appointed, and had a lovely view of the canal. I LOVED the shower (rain shower head and an amazing hand-held device)! I also really loved the bendable reading lamp which allowed me to read in the early hours of the morning without waking my girlfriend. We ended up having to reschedule our flights back to the US due to Hurricane Irene. Unfortunately, our room was not available the next night, so Rachel and Pepijn found us another bed and breakfast within walking distance and even helped us take our luggage there. In so many ways, they took care of us and provided service that went WAY beyond their responsibilities. I cannot imagine any guest who would not be happy staying at this lovely bed and breakfast. Everything is FIRST class -- the accomodations and the service. Thanks to Rachel and Pepijn for making my first visit to Amsterdam extremely comfortable and memorable! Pam W

Reviews.Title: “Character property in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: ownerjag
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in the Rembrandt room and enjoyed every minute. The room overlooks the street and can be a occasionally noisy but this is a conservation area and double glazing is not an option. The white noise machine soon overcame any distractions and we where not disturbed any more than at home . The room is a good size with enough space to chill our after a hard day sight seeing and a hot shower. The hotel is ideally located for walking to many of Amsterdam's sights and attractions and is an easy stroll from Central Station. Breakfast is relaxing and made to order with a good range of choices and at a time to suit being on holiday. The free minibar and wifi and substantial collection of guide books to borrow are mature touches which say that the Rachel and Pepijn have put a lot of effort it to the details in this hotel. I have stayed in plenty of places that could learn from them and that includes most of the big chains! This is a welcoming small hotel full of character, if you want the hotel equivalent of McDonalds then its not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Left with bad taste...”
Reviews.Author: Uri S
Reviews.Content: It's a shame, really. The hotel is pleasant enough (see the other reviews here), but I really didn't appreciate being hit with a rather hefty cancellation fee for a fifth night I have reserved but couldn't stay. To be fair, the owners mention a progressive cancellation fee in all their messages, but in most of the hotels I stayed in (quite a few over the years), this relates to "no shows", and not a shortened stay due to a change in plans. The owners also recommend that one should get an insurance to cover unplanned events, but these usually target cancelled trips and not minor changes. I, maybe naively, expect simple decency between people to resolve most of these. You might enjoy your stay at misc, but make sure to keep to your planned schedule. This is a "zero-tolerance" environment.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing B&B downtown Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: winnsley
Reviews.Content: I had a 2 nights stay there on a business seminaris trip in Amsterdam. The level of service was the same that I experienced in the big luxury hotels around the world. Not exactly the same though, since the breakfast is much better than any of them! The owner, Rachel, would do the impossible to fulfill every special need you could have. All is perfect, clean, silence, wifi Internet and even the location. Do not hesitate: I went there after reading TA review and never regret it. Rachel was even the reason why I decided to begin writing rating on TA.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic home-base in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: STJGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Amsterdam for the first time last October and we chose to stay at Misc. based on all of the great Trip Advisor reviews we read. We are so glad we did! Misc. is a cozy and comfortable hotel run by two incredibly gracious hosts- Rachel and Pepijn. They made us feel like we were friends staying in their home. Misc is very conveniently located just outside of the Red Light District in Nieumarket Square. We walked all over Amsterdam from the hotel and had the best time. We booked the lovely Wonders Room for 3 nights and always slept soundly in the oh-so-comfortable bed. The room and the spacious bathroom were immaculate. There were fresh cymbidium orchids in the room (a nice touch), as well as bathrobes and a Nepresso machine with various teas, coffees, and cocoas- perfect for those damp and chilly Amsterdam afternoons. We woke up each morning to Rachel and Pepijn preparing breakfast in the kitchen below. There was a nice assortment of coffees, teas, juices, pastry, fresh breads, fruit, local cheese, eggs, and cold cuts or bacon. Through Misc, we arranged for a private car to bring us to and from Schiphol Airport for appx 38 Euro each way (super convenient). And on our second day there, they arranged a private canal cruise and packed a little picnic for us with champagne- it was an awesome way to sit back (avoid the bike and trolley traffic) and see the city. Rachel and Pepijn also offered recommendations on excellent area restaurants- Cafe Bern and its delicious steak fondue was our favorite. We also enjoyed night caps of warm anise milk at Cafe Russland around the corner from the hotel. And lastly, as a final testament to the hospitality we experienced at Misc., we had a friend from back home meet up with us in Amsterdam, who wasn't staying at Misc, and each morning Pepijn or Rachel would let our friend up to our room and even invite her to stay for breakfast with us. While Misc might not be a perfect fit for travelers with disabilities (no elevator), or those looking for a gym, or 24hr Room Service, it was an absolute perfect fit for us and we wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else in Amsterdam. Thank you Rachel and Pepijn, for helping make our first trip to Amsterdam so memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, personal service, great location”
Reviews.Author: solarize_uk
Reviews.Content: A truly independent hotel, with lovely, helpful owners. The rooms are all different, and nicely designed. Lots to do nearby, and plenty of nice restaurants/bars. It's not cheap, and owners will need to ensure they continue to invest in keeping it top-notch.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Iamzediam
Reviews.Content: Rachel and her husband are incredible hosts. The room was just lovely and incredibly comfortable. The hotel's location is perfect and the style and flair of the hotel and rooms give a perfect representation of the real Amsterdam. The hotel provides a charming, delicious breakfast every day to get you started right. We cannot wait to return. I can only make wonderful comments about the hotel as staying here is truly a wonderful experience. If you are a value conscious traveler who wants to get immersed in the places you visit, then misc eatdrinksleep is absolutely a terrific choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - quirky and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Alfielola_11
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here and had the asian room overlooking the garden. Everything thought of and the free snacks and drinks a real treat. Friendly staff and Rachel was very informative and gave lots of recommendations of places to eat & visit. The New King chinese restaurant did not disappoint. Close to all essential touristy spots. Would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: BFBs
Reviews.Content: The hotel was conveniently located, clean, and comfortable. We enjoyed the breakfast that was served every morning (fresh bread, warm croissants, cheese, eggs to order, bacon, cappuccino, juices, fruit). They have a bunch of guide books to peruse and a laptop so that you can look up information online. Pepjin's demeanor can seem a bit indifferent at first, but he was very responsive and helpful when we approached him for advice. I'm afraid I did not get the name of the assistant who makes the breakfast, but he was super - friendly and helpful. Also, take advantage of the discounts they have with some of the tour operators. For example, you can get 4 tickets for a canal tour for the price of 3.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky but perfect”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug8
Reviews.Content: Not that this hotel needs our good review, but I thought I should leave it anyway just to add to the chorus of awesomeness. This hotel was wonderful and we can't wait to visit and stay here again. You absolutely cannot beat the location of this hotel - it's centrally located enough that we walked everywhere we wanted to go, but not so loud that we couldn't sleep with the windows open at night. The red light district is a five minute walk away so you can see that side of the city with ease if you're so inclined, but none of that spills out anywhere near the hotel so I would be comfortable staying here with kids. Our room looked out over the canal and the view was so perfect I had to double check that the exceptionally reasonable room rate we had been quoted was actually correct! The breakfast was serviceable, but what really stood out to us was the service. When we checked into the hotel the clerk was somewhat gruff and off-putting and I got a bad impression of the staff immediately. Imagine my surprise, however, when upon hearing that I had a headache the next morning and was not planning to come down for breakfast, that same clerk insisted on bringing me up a breakfast tray and tea. That level of service is something you can't even find in many five star hotels. This hotel doesn't have many rooms and fills up fast, so book early!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE LOVE LOVED IT! BEST HOTEL!!”
Reviews.Author: LalanRobbie
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location. Near the Red Light District, but is very safe. Owners - Rachel & Pepijn were very welcoming along with their assistant; Gabriel. Great rooms with creative decor. Nespresso machines in every room and fully-stocked mini fridge; refreshed daily and ----> FREE!! Breakfast is fresh and reliable. Nice selection. Very kind and hospitable with a bottle of champagne on my huband's bday as well. Lasltly, they carry all luggage up the stairs (which was very helpful). Free Internet. Highly highly recommended. Would definitely stay there on our next visit to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BungleZip
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay in the Rembrant room. A very relaxing hotel with perfect hosts and is well located for seeing all of Amsterdam. Highly recommended for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mgrace47
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights in May and really enjoyed ourselves. The innkeepers are wonderful, helpful and pleasant. The hotel is in a great location, literally 30 seconds from the SW corner of New Market Square. We spent three days hiking around the city from here. We requested the Rembrandt Room which is a favorite. Wonderful views overlooking the canel and active street life. They also provide an excellent breakfast to start the day and offer wonderful amenities, such as a couple of free beers, cold drinks and snacks in the room's mini-bar and high-speed internet. This is a terrific value for a high-priced city. Be aware that there is street noise and the stairs are narrow, but not too difficult for anyone who is reasonably healthy. But you really feel part of the city staying here. We would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Warm & Welcoming-A Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MaplePondHoppers
Reviews.Content: Misc eatdrinksleep is charming. The owners, Rachel & Pepijn are a lovely couple and very helpful to their guests. They love running the hotel and it shows. Our room was the 'Rembrandt' and it was comfortable and nicely decorated. The view of the canal was beautiful. The hotel is ideally situated on a canal near Nieuwmarkt Square and is within walking distance of all the important sites in historic Amsterdam. One of the highlights of our day was breakfast at Misc eatsleepdrink with fresh picked strawberries, fresh squeezed orange juice, lovely breads, bacon &eggs. Delicious! We loved this hotel and were sorry to leave. We highly recommend Misc eatsleepdrink - it's outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Friendly, Fab location!”
Reviews.Author: NotTooLate
Reviews.Content: My friend and I enjoyed our stay at this hotel after I'd found it recommended highly on Trip Advisor. The owners are very friendly and helpful, and the location is ideal for being in the heart of the action. The only caution I would give to potential visitors is that there is no elevator and the stairs are very steep and narrow. It's part of the charm of staying in an authentic Dutch canal-side house, but if you have any mobility problems then this is not the place for you. Otherwise, enjoy a fun and different experience!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small canal house hotel.”
Reviews.Author: wwtraveler_10
Reviews.Content: Small canal house hotel with just six rooms in Historic Amsterdam. Warm hospitality from the innkeepers Rachel and Pepijn. Our college age daughter was under the weather one night and they brought her takeout while we were out to dinner. Many thanks. The teenagers really enjoyed the funky "Design" room. The rooms are very well equipped with a coffee maker, and refrigerator with complementary drinks and snacks. White noise machine was helpful for the street noise. Loved our stay.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are right - this is a fantastic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sdjuk
Reviews.Content: Took the train from Paris to Amsterdam for a one-night stay with the wife and daughter. The location of the hotel is great. You can easily walk to everything. The owners are wonderful and very helpful with recommendations. Loved the room. Great view of the canal, very quiet at night and very comfortable beds. It was very nice having the free mini-bar and the breakfast was very good. Couldn't have been happier. Definitely recommend to anyone coming to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Central and superb”
Reviews.Author: AnniefromtheSmoke
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as we were looking for somewhere central, small and special. It did not disappoint on any of these counts. We chose a garden-facing room, which was lovely and quiet (the Baroque), with just the right amount of space. The minibar was very generously stocked with nice freebies and we adored the Nespresso machine. The owners, Rachel and Pepijn, were very helpful. By the way, if you are hesitant about staying in a small place because you think you won't be left in peace, that isn't a problem here, as the owners are nice and friendly but also quite unobtrusive. In summary, an excellent stay and we'll definitely be returning there when we next visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “True gem...river color with perfect clarity in dutch diamond speak”
Reviews.Author: bonzoll
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous experience with Misc Eatdrinksleep. My teenage son and I visited for three nights. We had a cosy room facing the canal, filled with homey touches like fresh flowers and fluffy white cotton robes. The room was immaculately clean. The rain shower very refreshing in the morning and after a long day of museum hopping. Breakfast was amazing. Made to order eggs, bacon, ham, cheese, cereals, various juices, fresh bread and croissants. Very top shelf, and no need to eat again until late in the day. There is also a complimentary stocked mini fridge that my son ravaged each evening. Coffee, tea and hot chocolate was also available in the room. In addition, our flight left early on our last day, so Rachel put together an breakfast tray for us the night before. Rachel and Pepijn were perfect hosts. Where else can you actually get a wake up call from the owners personally? They gave us great advice on transportation, sights, and places to eat. The location is amazing. . It is central and an easy walk to all points of interest in Amsterdam. No need to use the subway or the tram really. I felt extremely safe! I went out walking alone most evenings and never had a hint of trouble. Great trip, we will definitely go back. High speed internet was also included in the room

Reviews.Title: “We would go back!”
Reviews.Author: AlmondJ
Reviews.Content: Reallly enjoyed our stay in this hotel, we were in the Design Room at the front of the htoel literally looking down onto the canal. The location is really central and perfect for sight seeing, we walked everywhere. The the service was very friendly and helpful from recommending restaurants to having a big stack of guidebooks available to browse.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and room. The only downside being, we had to leave!”
Reviews.Author: Ge0rgica
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March 2011 with my partner. Was really impressed with the hotel, really quirky and unique. Each room has a different design, ours was the 'design' room and was lovely. Immaculately clean, both bedroom and en-suite. You also get a free min-fridge which is stocked up everyday! We had to check-out really early so the owners made sure we had breakfast in the room before we left, which was perfect. Breakfast is so nice, and you can have pretty much whatever you like. It is in an ideal location, walking distance from; cafes, bars, red light district, vintage shops, museums. I can't wait to go again, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “felt like we lived here for 4 days, rather than just visiting.”
Reviews.Author: weeboz
Reviews.Content: a birthday present from my boyfriend's parents for him and me, which is the only reason i marked down the 'value'. i don't know how much it cost but i know it was a bit pricey. but i'd expect a higher price if i received this level of comfort. the bed was like a big cloud (not a single disturbed sleep) and the fridge was stocked up every single day with apple juice, orange juice, chocolate bars and heineken. both the room itself and the en suite bathroom were spotless and nicely decorated. the location was great. felt like we were really in the centre. the place is a credit to rachel and pepijn, who made us breakfast, gave us a map and detailed directions and lent us a big golf umbrella!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, wonderful people!”
Reviews.Author: Rache_DB
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just got back from a 4 night stay at Misc eatdrinksleep. When I first looked at hotels they generally did seem a little pricey compared to what you might get in the U.K, but this really is a lovely hotel! The owners are very welcoming and friendly and only too happy to advise what to do/see. Their cat, Pru, is also a very cute addition! We had a canal view room which had plenty of space and some quirky features. I had read reviews where people had complained a bit about the noise- we were a little disturbed the first night, but this was a Saturday night and it didn't bother us as we realised if you want a central location then Amsterdam on a Saturday night isn't going to be quiet. Apparently the garden facing rooms are quieter, but it was really nice to look out over a canal so I think it is worth it! We slept fine, was just a bit noisy whilst trying to get to sleep. The rest of the stay was fine and we didn't hear a thing. The location is excellent- Anne Frank house is 15 mins walk, Centraal Station 10 mins walk, Dam square 10 mins, Van Gogh museum half hr walk, Red light district 2 mins! We didn't use the trams at all as everything is within walkging distance! We hired bikes from the hotel, which was at a competitive price. Again, Rachel and Pepijn (the owners) were on hand to recommend bike routes and lend us maps. I would definitely recommend this as it was so fun to cycle round and see a big of the countryside! I had also read a lot of breakfast in hotels in Amsterdam aren't included or a bit rubbish, but here they were delicious! Every morning we had a choice of cereal, fresh baked bread, a selection of Dutch cheeses, ham, homemade jam, eggs, bacon and croissant! Also as much coffee, tea and freshly squeezed orange as you like too! The rooms also had a free snack bar and were refilled every day! When we visit Amsterdam again we will definitely stay here again it was truly excellent! I highly recommend staying at misc eatdrinksleep!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, helpful, comfortable, quirky, amazing views, central”
Reviews.Author: Barwise
Reviews.Content: We wanted a central hotel that was a bit different and on the canal. Misc eatdrinksleep was perfect for us. Old, slightly faded, wonderfully lived-in and loved. We stayed on the very top floor with stunning views across the canal. For such a central situation it was very quiet. There was a white noise machine which was great if you find a city keeps you awake. Bed was oceanic and comfortable. Bathroom small but great shower and separate loo. Would have been nice to have a music system. You step out the door and there's everything a little walk away so it was perfect for us. Rachel was very friendly and could not have been more helpful, we got a lot of info via email before we left. Her husband was a little shyer with a sense of humour if you make an effort. Great breakfasts and we ordered a bottle of fizzy for our arrival and it was there in lots of ice all ready. We loved the Deco sauna, early 20th Century glamour and wonderful massage, loads of good restaurants and a real laid-back weekend, I'd definintely go and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, welcoming and comfortable stay near everything”
Reviews.Author: Lovingston_VA
Reviews.Content: We were on our way to India but got "stuck" in Amsterdam due to snows. I can't imagine a better place to be stuck. From the moment we walked in Rachel was welcoming and made us feel at home. She even gave us the Indian themed room and pointed us to great Indian food down the street! The room was very nice and the breakfast was lovely. We will certainly come again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with a lot of charm”
Reviews.Author: ClaraMi
Reviews.Content: Small and unique hotel with only 7 rooms - which makes you feel like a guest in the owners home. The owners are really friendly and helpfull, the rooms are really nice, clean and spatious - with a free minibar, tv and comfy beds. The location is really good esp. when you are on foot - and the hotel has bikes you can borrow aswell. Overall good value for money and perfect personal service! Please go...

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Dan_Pez
Reviews.Content: Superb old canal house hotel 2 minutes from the centre and very quiet. Great rooms full of character with huge comfortable beds and good quality pillows. There was a complimentary mini bar which was restocked each day and and free broadband. The breakfast was excellent and the hosts Rachel and Pepijn were friendly and very helpful. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! But remember, it's Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: SenorVP
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay at Misc Eatdrinksleep and we concur completely with the high ratings this hotel has received on TripAdvisor. The location, while in a busy, youthful area of the city was great for us. We took a train from the airport to the central station and the hotel is an easy walk. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go and, as Rachel and Pepijn mentioned in an earlier reply, the proximity of the Red Light District is truly a non-issue. You need to walk several blocks to get there and we had no problem avoiding it save for a brief curiosity-satiating visit. Rachel and Pepijn were gracious and helpful. Our room was large, light and clean; contrasting with the tiny room we had stayed in in London the day before. We stayed in the Rembrandt room which is in the front on the hotel and while there was some noise from the street the bed was so comfortable that sleep was tough to disturb. Misc also provides a white noise machine, but we really did not need it. We did visit one of the back rooms and, if you are sensitive to even minimal noise, that would be the way to go. The breakfast was excellent, particularly the breads and pastries. After the canned orange juice that seems to be everywhere in Europe, the fresh-squeezed orange juice at Misc was a pleasant surprise. While the common area is a bit cluttered we know from past trips that this is Amsterdam; space is at a premium and I'd rather have it in my room than in the entryway! As mentioned, the neighborhood is somewhat youth-oriented. There are four coffee shops ( where the pot is more important than the coffee) on the same block and it is only a few doors from University of Amsterdam but we felt perfectly safe and despite being in our 50's enjoyed the vibe. We used to stay at the Canal House (20 to 30 years ago!) and were disappointed when we found it to be closed for renovations. No longer. When we return, Misc eatdrinksleep will definitely be in our plans!

Reviews.Title: “ultra cool and chilled”
Reviews.Author: susanlatimer
Reviews.Content: what an amazing hotel, easy to locate from train station, warm welcome , bags taken and restaurants booked ..nothing is too much for these guys . room was clean , quiet .... u were left alone to come and go , breakfast more than i could ask for .... and will b expecting from other hotels:-}, i will go back as it is so central to the city and sights ... love the red light district , visited kop van jurt for dinner very reasonable and chilled , have mint tea its fab and refreshing...

Reviews.Title: “Truly Magnificent”
Reviews.Author: KerBro
Reviews.Content: This wonderful 6 room hotel was perfect for my daughter and I for the night. The location is central to all exhibits, landmarks, and sightseeing - most within walking distance. Knowledgeable suggestions for food and we were not disappointed. Homemade breakfast served in the morning was delicious and felt like home with Dutch touches to make it special. Beautiful view, easy access, typical European room style - larger than most in my experience. Wish we could have stayed several nights, will definitely book there again when my husband joins me in the spring for another trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “One Happy Camper”
Reviews.Author: Mark-choosy-chappy
Reviews.Content: In Amsterdam I have tended to stay at the corporate 5*s and always feel like I am in a processing plant, and not always an efficient one at that. I deciced to give Misc. a shot just for a change and I would be telling fibs if I said I was not a tad anxious about what I would find. I loved it! Yes it is small and dare I say a little quirky but I felt more comfortable here than I can remember being in a hotel in a long time. Normally I dread breakfast at the big hotels, never mind the 25 euro buffet rip offs, the food is usually naff. In contrast my breakfast at misc was comfortable, relaxing and guess what really excellent. I deducted one star for value simply because I booked late and paid 165 euros which a iittle on the high side but more than made up for by the team carrying my luggage up the stairs (we are talking narrow and steep), booking taxis, calling my restaurant to say I was running late. A real gem.

Reviews.Title: “Trip advisor reviews were spot on.”
Reviews.Author: blnk
Reviews.Content: This is a 6 room hotel in the center of Amsterdam so comparing it to a Ritz or Four Seasons resort somewhere is not appropriate. So, for what it is, it is great. The owners are hands on and helpful. The insisted on getting me up and serving me a great early breakfast before my flight and I was rewarded with one of the best cups of coffee I have ever had - and I drink a lot of coffee. The room I had on the second floor was solid and very quiet for a hotel in the midst of a city. You cannot beat the location for the center of Amsterdam and it is convenient to the train station. I didn't take advantage of the bikes but that is a great feature. Something that you may not see anywhere else in the world is the FREE mini bar that is fully stocked and included in your room, it is a great feature. If you have trouble with stairs, you may want to stay elsewhere as they are steep. Nevertheless, you should stay here.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location, perfect service”
Reviews.Author: bozkocak
Reviews.Content: We spent our second half of honeymoon in Amsterdam. Amsterdam is a small city so if you dont stay in a country hotel you're always in the center of the city. Misc is very close to Central Station. We arrived there with ten minutes walk. The hotel is a traditional canal house with a wonderful canal view. The best thing about the hotel is themed rooms. We were in Africa and we loved it but if I ever go to Amsterdam again I want to stay at Rembrandt:) The rooms are really spacey with large beds and big windows. The mini bar is free and there is a nespresso machine with various kinds of coffee which are also free. There is a white noise machine for light sleepers but we are used to big city noises so Amsterdam was very quite for our ears. Rachel- the hotel owner- was really helpful. We asked her some questions about the city and she answered all of them patiently. Pepjin was also very helpful. When we asked him if there were any dangerous area that we shouldnt go he actually smiled:) They serve delicious breakfasts with dutch cheese, ham, bacon, eggs, jams, butter etc. Delicious! And when we came back to hotel on the second day's night there were new flowers in our room which matches the room colors. The location may look a little scary if you've never been to Amsterdam because it's parallel to Red Light District. But Amsterdam is a very safe city. We walked around the Red Light at night and there were older Chinese people with umbrellas who were looking at the girls:) It's just a touristic site for most of the people. I truly recommend Misc for its location, services and decoration.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: Dees-Cork
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, very central clean and comfortable. Would definatly stay here again when visiting Amsterdam, charming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: DavePenny
Reviews.Content: Spent a short week here and could not have been happier. Rachel and Pepjin were perfect hosts, knowledgeable and very informative. Rooms are comfortable and well equiped, quiet as well. The location is superb. If you can't be bothered to walk far there is a choice of dozens of restaurants and bars within a hundred metres. If you go to Amstedam and want to experience the real city you have to stay in the Old town, and this hotel is situated on a canal side next to a large market square. Go. Stay. Eat drink and sleep. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home”
Reviews.Author: claui
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here, we felt very much at home in this little hotel. We stayed in room 6 for a week, the baroque room on the third floor and although it's one of the smaller rooms, we didn't feel like we needed more space at all. There is no elevator, but they were very kind in carrying my enormous suitcase up. The breakfast was fabulous and also the minibar was free which included drinks (incl beer), chips and chocolate. The only thing is that we felt the owner was a bit hot and cold, sometimes being very friendly and talkative, sometimes being a bit short or almost ignoring us. Once he was being rude at the lovely staff member that prepared our breakfast each morning. We would recommend this hotel to anyone who can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Complete package”
Reviews.Author: Kaimada
Reviews.Content: We really cannot say enough good things about our experience while staying at this hotel. My partner and I found the hotel to be very nice in terms of location, room size, breakfasts, etc. However, it was the owners who made for such a wonderful experience in Amsterdam. Since it is a smaller place, there was none of the usual â€œpassports pleaseâ€� mentality but rather just a â€œwelcome, make yourself comfortable and what would you like to exploreâ€� feel to the hotel. Both provided welcome assistance from providing travel guidance/printing out tickets, to restaurant reservations and even booked a private boat for the hotel guests on Queenâ€™s Day. Given the charm of Amsterdam, I can easily see us returning in the next 5 years and without a doubt we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pray that they have rooms available for your visit to Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: SKCTokyo
Reviews.Content: The property: A six-room hotel owned and run by a young, witty couple, Rachael and Pepijn (pronounced correctly as â€œPepineâ€�), who are the real attractions of the hotelâ€¦â€¦and a very personable old cat who supplies the diplomatic muscle. My room was unusual by the standards in the hospitality-factory industry, but clean, comfortable, airy, and totally charming. If you are there for art, sightseeing, and architecture, both of the owners are fountains of information as to what to see: Rachael (American), in fact, is after her Masterâ€™s in architecture. Thereâ€™s a very nice bar and a hotel computer in the entrance, which also allows you a great people-watching perch, as does the bench outside the hotel. The location: On one of the canals close to the â€œdisreputableâ€� area, but far enough away to be divorced from the tourist mosh pit. Easy walking distance from the train station. For the first time visitor (and even additional visits), the location is perfect. Hotel gripes: None whatsoever. Misc is more like a home stay with a really great family. I hated to leave. On this trip I stayed in 10 different hotels, all of them nice. However, Misc, their owners, and their drowsy cat were special and constituted more of a holistic travel experience than you are ever likely to get elsewhere. Just a joy.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Galila
Reviews.Content: What do you look for in a hotel for a vacation? In my view, It should be something a bit special and with home comforts that enable you to enjoy your time throughout your stay. The Misc is that place in Amsterdam. It is not a 'hotel' in the truest definition. It is a guest house, a very special guest house and the owners make you feel very much at home. The rooms are larger than the usual Euro-Hotels mini rooms and as you may have read in many of the reviews, the beds are very comfortable. But, its the extras that make this place so very good. First of all, the all inclusive price ( taxes, service etc. ) incorporating a made-to-your pleasure breakfast , nespresso coffee and mini-bar full of goodies stocked daily - these are truly special additions you won't find anywhere else. The location is also great. Yes, the rooms facing the canal were a 'bit noisy' but hey, this is the heart of amsterdam not a countryside hamlet. You can't miss with the Misc. Trust me, i've stayed at some great locations in this city and this guest house/hotel was by far the best of the crop.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel from which to explore Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: donlea_10
Reviews.Content: My husband, and I were priveledged to spend 3 nights at this marvellous hotel. The great advantage of this hotel is the quality of service offered by both Rachel and Pepijn the owners of this wonderful gem situated on one of the many canals in central Amsterdam. The posiive reviews on this hotel are defnately not overstated. The breakfast was everything you could ask for, the room was beautiful and well furnished and the special treats in the fridge were a welcome to come home to after a day out exploring. We were getting up early on our first day as we were booked on a tour to watch the Sail 2010 festival, Rachel wouldn't hear of us leaving without breakfast so organised a special early one just for us. Nothing was too much trouble for these people. My husband and I cannot rate them high enough.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting, authentically quaint place, however reviews are overated”
Reviews.Author: m1a2a3
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 2 nights at the misc after a 2 week riverboat cruise. I wanted something "authentically Amsterdam" instead of a "standard" hotel, and that is what the misc offers. On the positive side, Rachel was absolutely wonderful, welcoming, and helpful, something that you might not always get at the large hotels. The bed was extremely comfortable, but the room was small (common in Europe) and the "common area" where the "bar" is and where you eat breakfast, is very small also. We were in the "Wonder" room and it was somewhat bizarrely decorated and had a huge crack in one wall. The minifridge with complimentary mini snacks was nice and the included breakfast was adequate. The location was very good not being too close to the Red light district and not being on a really busy "tourist" street or canal. On the negative side, on hindsight we would have rather stayed at a little bit bigger place with more common area so we could interact with other travelers and have somewhere to lounge when we were not out walking all over Amsterdam. This was not an option at the misc. The Radison Blu is about a block away and is far more luxurious with the same location. In summary, as always it is simply what you are looking for. Is this the 5th best place to stay in Amsterdam? If so, there is something really missing in Amsterdam. Is it a nice little B & B and will you be treated well? Yes. Would we stay there again if we go back to Amsterdam? No. If you would like anymore information on this hotel or on Amsterdam please feel free to contact me.

Reviews.Title: “We won't stay anywhere else when we...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We won't stay anywhere else when we return to amsterdam :) We loved the rooms, the view, breakfast, everything!

Reviews.Title: “First visit to Amsterdam - we loved the Misc!”
Reviews.Author: bestgambianprice
Reviews.Content: The rooms are light and feel spacious; each is decorated in a different style. The beds are really comfortable with good quality bedding. We had a 'garden view' room which was on the 'quiet' side of the hotel with free snacks and drinks from the 'mini bar' - replenished daily. A room safe was provided and there was a 'Nespresso' machine which produced a variety of hot drinks including excellent coffee. All of this was free! Breakfast consisted of fresh fruit, cereals, cheese and ham, a delicious variety of fresh breads, croissants and preserves, complete with freshly made orange juice. Rachel and Pepijn were friendly and helpful, even starting before we arrived by booking us a taxi from the airport to Misc. They arranged boat trips for us which were wonderful; Rachel even loaned us hats and provided drinks for us. On the way home, we had a problem with Easyjet which resulted in us missing the flight but thankfully there was a room free at Misc so we were able to stay for another night (which wasn't a exactly a hardship!) We are looking forward to our next vist and will recommend the Misc to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying with family”
Reviews.Author: partialfish
Reviews.Content: Pepijn and Rachel are the ultimate innkeepers. Their little hotel is located superbly, and they will make sure you know where to go and what to do. It takes all the stress out of an Amsterdam visit, and their breakfasts will sustain you throughout the day. This was the perfect launch to our 2-wk European vacation, and I would stay in Amsterdam again just to stay at this place, no kidding! We had the Africa room at the top floor on the canal side, and it was wonderful. Watch those weird Dutch stairs, though!

Reviews.Title: “Warm and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Ladymay72
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my sister to celebrate her 40th birthday - the design room was lovely, overlooking the canal. The owners were very helpful, providing us with information throughout our stay. The complimentary drinks and snacks in the room are a great touch and the breakfast each morning was superb. Would definately stay here again - it was charming.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice!!”
Reviews.Author: dougsnowla
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at misc eatdrinksleep. Rooms are nice and beds are very comfortable. Great location with bars, restaurants, train station, and even a grocery store are close. Rachel is very helpful with anything you need. Breakfast very nice too. Very nice place to stay. If ever back in Amsterdam, I will try and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “location - ideal, owners - adorable”
Reviews.Author: OfeRika
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the misc for a long weekend. Location is ideal - in a fairly QUIET canal street at the periphery of the red light district, right next to the Nieuwmarkt square (but not on it). It's a small 6-rooms, kind of B&B, hotel with a very friendly and cozy atmosphere. We stayed at the top canal-facing room, which was very comfortable - everything is clean and in place - all the required accessories - including free internet connection, safe, and a mini bar full of things, and for FREE (drinks, snacks, even Heineken beer etc...). There was hardly any noise from the street. Being used to the Amsterdam staircases, we had no trouble walking up the three floors of steep stairs (for the more elderly this might be less convenient, but that's a general Amsterdam issue...). And now for the owners - the adorable Rachel & Pepijn - even after having read some reviews, we didn't expect such a high degree of generosity and assistance. Breakfasts, prepared by the owners, were excellent too - a variety of breads, cereals, delicious dutch cheeses (ask them where to buy cheese if you want to take some home with you), omelets... all that one needs for a good start of the day. We warmly recommend to buy museum tickets at the hotel. We bought tickets for both the Rijks and Hermitage, and this really saves the queues, enabling to take the "fast lines" right to the entrance. We also recommend the "hop on hop off canal bus", and tickets for this may also be purchased at the hotel. If liking cheese fondue - Cafe Bern is the place, in the square right next to the hotel. All in all - a wonderful location - right at the center but yet fairly quiet and relaxed, very comfortable rooms, great atmosphere and very helpful and generous owners. Looking forward to return there; maybe try some of the other uniquely-designed rooms... Rika & Ofer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with warm friendly service in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: inkstop
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were there for four nights in the Rembrandt room the last week of March and we were very happy with the accomodations and the personal and friendly hospitality given by Rachel and Pepijn. They were more than gracious and served up the best breakfast you can ask for along with helpful tips on getting the most out of Amsterdam including some good Dutch restaurants and great towns to visit out of the city. The place is well situated in the middle of everything but also quiet at night so you can sleep. I would recommend the hotel and would return there for sure the next time we visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “the PERFECT end to our Honeymoon!!!”
Reviews.Author: SINGSTHESONGS
Reviews.Content: we had a belated honeymoon, being we married in December and we decided to goto Paris, Cologne Germany and Amsterdam... we JUST got back. trip was from march29-april 6... we were on somewhat of a budget being we are traveling to so many cities yet we wanted quality! this hotel was PERFECT for that! Great Price, Location and Room for a Petit Price... well, compared to some of the other hotels! we had a garden room (which was quiet but not really a garden but cute none the less). our room was romantic and comfy and all the things you'd want on a honeymoon! baroque room #6. top floor which you have to travel ALL those steps that are narrow and steep but Pepyjn is a SUPER HELP with them. . . even though his eyes popped out of his head when he saw our luggage... hehe OK... Pepjyn & Rachel . . . the AMAZING owners and runners of this place. we LOVED them. want to visit them when we return and become friendly with them over all, THAT is how great they are! at first Pepjyn is serious, but give him a second and he's just as goofy as the rest of us. . .Rachel has these lovely big eyes and is funny and charming as well! BOTH are truly amazing and no words are good enough to describe them! REALLY! they had the best recommendations for restaurants, any kind of sightseeing, how to get tix and whats the best time to go. . . they had all the right answers! even the guy they used to take us back to the hotel, i have to find his full info, but his name is Ramon and he is the MOST CHARMING MAN IN HOLLAND! we LOVED him as well and in turn, just made this experience even greater as our stay. we were SO glad we ended our honeymoon here. . .room was great, they surprised us with a kind easter/honeymoon treat, the people were amazing, the city was fascinating and i cannot wait to return to this city AND this hotel... OH... and their breakfast...HOLY HOLY WOW WOW... filing, amazingly delicious and FREE! as is their minibar that WE LOVED! if you can't tell already, WE LOVED THIS PLACE! staff was BEYOND HELPFUL and kind. . . rooms were clean, cute and beds...VERY COMFY! A+ + + RATING!!!

Reviews.Title: “A highlight of our visit to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: nicelynicely
Reviews.Content: Misc eatdrinksleep really should be categorized as a Bed and Breakfast. The proprietors, Rachel and Pepijn, run the place themselves and take good care of the guests. My fiance and I found them to be really delightful. The location is perfect, right in the heart of old Amsterdam and a short walk from Centraal Station. Be sure to write down the address before you arrive if you plan to find your own way there. I walked right past the hotel and got us lost. It's easy to miss if you aren't paying attention. We stayed in the Afrika Room, which is on the top floor (4th floor) facing the canal/street. The furnishings and decor are great and the free drinks and snacks in the fridge are a good bonus. The bathroom with the shower is very small, but I hardly expected different. The only problem we had was the street noise. Not at night surprisingly, but in the early morning. Construction crews were doing some work on the sidewalk across the canal. Besides this construction work the other normal sounds from the street do make their way up and through the window. There is a white noise device to help mask the outside sound and aid your sleeping, but next time I think we'll stay in one of the garden view rooms. The free breakfast is also great. Don't skip it. If we come back to Amsterdam, we'll definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay to explore the city”
Reviews.Author: Gegster
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Misc in March 2009 and chose the hotel after reading reviews on here. We arranged with the hotel to be picked up from the airport and the chauffer driven merc arrived on time and without hassle. The pleasant driver gave us a short tour of the city before dropping us off at the hotel. Rachel welcomed us in the most friendly and professional way and was the perfect host all the time we stayed. We had booked 3 nights which was more than enough to explore the city - during which time Rachel booked us tables at superb restaurants and recommended tours and sights not to miss. The rooms are comfortable and warm although the bathrooms are small - however the free fridge bar is a super idea and was most welcome after a day exploring the city. Breakfasts are plentiful and fresh - cooked right in front of you. As for Amsterdam - it is small enough to 'do' in 2 days and coming from the UK, we did notice how expensive the fall in the value of the pound has made coming here. 2 coffees for 10 euros and dinner for 2 for 100 euros is pretty steep. However we were on holiday and we took the hit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hospitality, great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: ViaAmable
Reviews.Content: We just completed a wonderful, four night stay at eatdrinksleep. It was one of the best lodging experiences we have ever had, and my wife and I have traveled a great deal all over the world. The owners, Rachel and Pepijn, could not have been more helpful. They gave us several terrific restaurant tips and accurate directions on how to walk or take the tram to every place we wanted to go. The breakfasts were bountiful, all the food was fresh from the shop/bakery, and they were glad to serve multiple cups of very good coffee. Our room, overlooking the canal, was quite comfortable, though modest in size. Our only caution is that the stairs are narrow, circular and steep. We stayed on the third (4th in U.S) floor, enjoyed the view, and were not bothered by the climb, especially since the owners carry all bags up and down. But if you're bothered by steep, winding stairs, you'd probably be happier on the first floor.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Clean & Quiet”
Reviews.Author: bingohandjob01
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, boutique style small B&B. Room was comfortable, clean and quiet. Given I was at the top and it was snowing, it was also warm. Soft drinks and snacks in the room a pleasant touch included in the price - I paid â‚¬125 inc. breakfast. Rachel very friendly and helpful, Pepijn I found less so, almost rude. Overall would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A really friendly and pleasant B&B”
Reviews.Author: Friend_of_Barbra
Reviews.Content: Rachel and Pepjin offer the most friendly welcome, without ever being over-attentive. They gave us the perfect advice on what to do and see (particularly architecturally) and where to eat. Really felt more like staying with friends than in a hotel. The rooms are actually quite spacious for Amsterdam and we had a nice postcard view out over the canal. Comfortably furnished and full of character. Bit of noise at night, but nothing that kept us awake - there are rooms looking over the garden if this would be a problem. The breakfast was another highlight, fresh and plentiful and served in a homely manner. And in the presence of their aloof cat. Would definately stay there again. (And, it goes without saying, totally gay-friendly).

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: shapeset
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay, close to the centre of things, great room that faced the canal. Very helpful owners, nothing too much trouble, and they can get you into all the best places. If you are sick of the bland big hotels, or even if you are not, then this is one for you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sophie fishing
Reviews.Content: Excellent, central location good for walking round the city. We had a lovely canal view. We could hear street noise very occasionally in the night but it didn't disturb us at all (although may be less in December than summer). Very comfortable rooms. Extremely welcoming hosts, who helped us orientate ourselves, gave info on opening times, booked taxis and a restaurant, provided copy of Time Out etc... I recommend you take advantage of the offer of the hotel arranging airport pickup, as the driver was very courteous and slightly cheaper than just going to the taxi rank. A highlight for us was the fabulous breakfasts (served til 12noon!) we had freshly squeezed orange juice, hot chocolate, egg, delicious dutch cheese, bacon, fresh bread, granola, smoothie...! bliss! We had such a wonderful weekend and it was certainly made better by having picked such a good hotel. (One point - very tall narrow stairs, typical of Amsterdam canal houses. Hosts carried our luggage up for us, and we had no problem with it, but not good if you have trouble walking up stairs.)

Reviews.Title: “Home from home”
Reviews.Author: Kixie
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in this darling little hotel and it was a home from home for us for the duration of the trip. The owners, Rachel and Pepjin, are delightful. Friendly in a low-key and unobtrusive manner, which puts a person at ease, they are nevertheless willing to help in anyway possible. The hotel only has six rooms, all themed. We stayed in the Rembrandt room, which evoked the period of the painter's life. It was generously sized, with a large comfortable bed and two large windows overlooking the canal outside. Although there was activity outside at all hours, we never had any trouble sleeping or, for that matter, sleeping in! Little touches, such as the complimentary in-room mini-bar with soft drinks and snacks, are very welcome and again contribute to a relaxed sense of ease and homeliness. If you are worried about the noise bothering your sleep, and it was never a problem for us, a white noise generator is thoughtfully provided. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and will use it again if we visit Amsterdam, without hesitation. Cat lovers will also appreciate the discrete presence of Pru in the hotel lobby.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous ,friendly hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: xavt
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights here and had a great time.The detailed emailed instructions on how to get there from the airport were really helpful and we found Pepijn and Rachel really welcoming.The room (Rembrandt) was a good size and comfortable and we had views over the canal which were beautiful ,although we did have to close the windows at night to keep out some of the partygoers noise. The "white noise" box helped with that greatly. Breakfasts were excellent. Rachel and Pepijn's help and frendliness is the standout feature of our visit. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fab place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AndyTracey
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we were made to feel welocme and at home. Rachel and Pepijn were most helpful in recommending superb places to eat and we were not disappointed. However the quality of food and service does not come cheap, but well worth the experience as that occasional special treat. Our room catered for all of our needs and the bed was very very comfortable. Ideally located for all the sights of Amsterdam both day and night and most within easy walking distance. We would definately recommend this lovely small friendly hotel to our friends and the place to stay when visiting Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “like staying with old friends”
Reviews.Author: CathyECyprus
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend staying at this unique and wonderful little Hotel. Location is fantastic, beds and pillows very comfy! Can't think of anywhere else we have ever stayed where everything was so perfect. Well done Rachael and Pepjin for getting everything so right, You can walk to Central station easily from here and everywhere our hosts suggested we eat was superb. Picked this hotel from other reviews and we suggest you do the same, you won't be dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “If only we could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: sugarmanNewton_MA
Reviews.Content: The other reviews cover it well. Misc eatdrinksleep is a lovely, charming place in a great location run by nice, helpful people. The rooms are very comfortable, bright, and imaginatively decorated, without the decor taking over. Having stayed in too many hotels with tripwired mini-bars, it was a treat to have a little fridge stocked with complimentary non-alcoholic drinks and snacks (free!) that was replenished every day. We greatly appreciated Rachel and Pepijn's hospitality and their good breakfasts. While we're on the subject of food, we loved the herring and other seafood sandwiches sold by street vendors. Pepijn recommended Bird for reasonably priced, yummy Thai food, and we ate there twice, once in the restaurant and once in the snack bar across the street. We continue to have great success using TripAdvisor. We would never have found misc eatdrinksleep without it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cookysue
Reviews.Content: Hotel Misc is unique and probably the reason we had the best vacation ever. Thanks to Rachel and Pepijn we had everything we needed and the guidance to have a wonderful stay in Amsterdam. These great people went out of their way to make our stay as comfortable and enjoyable as possible. I have to agree with all the good reviews on this site and want to say we found the hotel very clean and comfortable. The bed was extremely comfortable and my husband said he felt like he was sleeping in a cloud. The mini fridge and coffee machine were great extras. The breakfast was great and a wonderful way to start the day in Amsterdam. I have never written a review of a hotel before, but wanted to put my two cents in and let people know what a great place this is. We stayed in a canal view room and were very comfortable. There is street noise with the window open, but with the window closed we didn't hear a thing. We also loved the white noise machine and ceiling fan. When we mentioned the noise to Rachel she offered to switch us to a garden view room. We didn't want to move however and had a great stay and slept quite well. The location is excellent and we walked everywhere. I could not give a place a better review. It is just a great place and I can't wait until we can go back again and bring some friends.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Trip Advisor once again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MELCOR
Reviews.Content: We found this place using TA, and once again it did not disappoint! This little B&B is great! The Rachael and Pepijn are genuine people. They make you feel very comfortable and welcome. The location was the best part. Minutes to anthinig you want. We loved going for a late night walk through the red light district, great people watching. Then when you have had enough your room is just around the corner. The stocked fridge is a nice touch as well. Great for those late night munchies :) Breakfast was yum. Our last day there we had an early flight, so upon returning to our room on our last night we found a cute spread of bread and cheese and hard boiled eggs for our early departure. We stayed for 5 nights, and wished we could have stayed longer. Amsterdam is a great city, with so much to see. I would definately stay here again next time. Great people, great location, great room, great breakfast. Book it....you will love it :) P.S there is a chinese massage just a couple of doors down. It is totally professional, and open until 11 pm. After a long day of walking ( and trust me you will be be doing LOTS of walking) it was so nice to get a couples massage and then stumble back to our room which was 1 minute away.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Comfortable - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ebee1
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend this lovely boutique hotel with the neat theme rooms and fantastic breakfasts! The location is perfect - walking distance from the train station and to the Dam Square. Rachel and Pipijn were most accomodating and kept out luggage until our room was ready for us to check in. We stayed in the The Desgn room facing the canal. It was very clean and the bed was comfy. The mini fridge was well stocked with drinks and snacks that were compliments of the hotel. Our friends stayed next door in the Wonders room. A very beautiful room with Indian - Asian decor. Our Desgn room was al white with a more modern effect. Each floor of the hotel has two rooms. Our two rooms were in the first floor - one flight of stairs. Each morning we had a delicious breakfast prepared by Rachel including fresh squeezed orange juice with bacon, eggs, great cheeses, toast, fresh fruit and coffee. It was truly a meal that set us up for the day! Thank you Rachel! Dont forget to get directions from Rachel and Pippijn for the Flea Market which is only a few blocks away. It is near the Rembrant House whcih is also a must! The location of the Misc offers plenty of restuarants and bars directly outside the door and down the streets. You will enjoy your stay at Misc - we certainly did and hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “It's like having family in Holland!!”
Reviews.Author: Cowboysrule
Reviews.Content: Rachel & Pepijn run an OUTSTANDING little hotel. I would stay with them again in a heart beat. Truly great location, very central and an easy walk from the station if you don't have too much to carry. The rooms are large, modern and very clean. They are also stocked with FREE gourmet coffee, juices, soda, water and snacks. Rachel let me use a lap top to check e-mail throughout our stay (high speed and free) so I didn't have to drag my lap top along.
