She was also a great resource for where to go (to eat, for live music, antiques, museum times and on and on...). While we were there it was quite warm, but the rooms had fans and the windows opened, so we were never bothered by the temps or noise outside (very quiet). It truly felt like we were visiting family and can't say enough kind things about them or there great hotel. It's a true hidden gem and will enhance your stay in Amsterdam. Rent bikes! It may seem crazy when you first arrive, but the bike traffice flows so smoothly, we felt safer riding bikes then walking!! Besides, it allows you to cover so much more of the town. Make sure to ride through Vondel Park and you MUST go by the last great record store left in our downloadable world, "Concerto". If you have enough time, you can easily bike your way into the country side and see windmills and great vista.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: NipIreland
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short break in Amsterdam and I have to agree with the majority of people who have reviewed Misc. This is a lovely six roomed hotel situated in a traditional old Amsterdam house. The hotel is right beside Nieuwmarkt which is a beautiful old square and is within easy walking distance of all the most popular areas in Amsterdam. The main building in the square is the Waag which has to be seen lit up at night. It's beautiful. Our room was at the front of the hotel and therefore overlooked the canal.Some people have commented on the noise at night but I really didn't notice this, and we were sleeping with the windows open. It was lovely to waken in the morning and watch the boats and the ducks, and see people already going about their day. The room was really well stocked, with a good free mini bar and coffee maker. The bathroom was well equipped with high quality products and again had everything we needed. The main selling point of this hotel is the owners. During our stay they couldn't have been nicer..even down to posting my mail! Our arrival in Amsterdam was delayed, but our welcome at the hotel was quick and friendly. The hotel has a compact breakfast area where we were served a very generous breakfast. The Dutch breakfast of breads, cheeses, ham, cereal and fruit are all served, but the owners served freshly squeezed orange juice, fantastic coffee and bacon and eggs which they made while we chatted. This is a great wee hotel and I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, lovely atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: TimsAway
Reviews.Content: Really delighted with our stay. Although our room could possibly have done with a better clean (the inside of the cupboard was dusty), that was more than compensated for by the stylish decor and comfortable bed. The location was absolutely perfect, too, which means it's easy to pop back to the hotel during the day. It's a little pricey, but worth it for having somewhere a little different. And there are nice touches, like a free mini-bar with soft drinks and snacks, plus free and fast Wi-Fi.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel”
Reviews.Author: laughingsheep
Reviews.Content: Location The hotel is an easy 10-15 minute walk from Centraal Station. It's on the edge of the Red Light district, but if you feel strongly about it, the Red Light district can be easily avoided. Rooms We stayed in the Baroque room which is on the top floor, over looking the back of the hotel. It's described as a garden view, which puts a slightly positive spin on it, as there isn't really the space in Amsterdam to create gardens worth looking at! However, we didn't go on holiday to spend our time in the room looking out so it wasn't a problem. The room was a good size and nicely furnished, although showing a few minor signs of wear and tear e.g. a small tear in the wallpaper. The bed was large a comfortable with pristine white sheets and covers. There was room for two seats and a nest of tables along with the fridge and nespresso coffee machine. The fridge contained a range of drinks (water, orange/apple juice, smoothies and coke/sprite) and some snacks (crisps, chocolate, cinnamon rolls) which were all included in the room rate along with a couple of fresh chocolate buns and a welcome note from the owners which was a nice touch. The bathroom was clean and functional, however, apart from the rain shower, the bathroom wasn't decorated to the same standard as the room. This isn't to say there was anything wrong with it, it just didn't have that wow factor. A plus point was that it had proper windows which could be opened, which is unusual in many larger hotel bathroooms. Food The hotel is small, with only six bedrooms, so just serves breakfast. The breakfast is a good continental style, with fresh bread and croissants, ham and cheese and an egg in the style of your choice plus tea, coffee, water and freshly squeezed orange juice. It's served between 9-12, earlier upon request. This seems to fit in with the general laid back style of Amsterdam though - we found shops and attractions where relatively late to open. Value for money The hotel is nicely presented and well run, we found the owners Rachel and Pepjin to be very helpful with advice on where was good to eat and information on flight delays (we were there during the closure of some UK airports due to snow). Amsterdam seems to be quite expensive for accomadation, and this is emphasised by with the poor exchange rate between sterling and the euro. Taking that into account, I felt that this hotel provided good value for money and a personalised service that you wouldn't get from larger hotels and I would be happy to make a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Ad astra et ultra *”
Reviews.Author: nomeiodomar
Reviews.Content: *Towards the stars and much beyond! Thatâ€™s what happened to me and my mother â€“ it was much greater than what we were expecting. Booked this hotel for a week (12th to 19th Aug.). Prior to it, I had been planning a week in a beautiful European town. Iâ€™d give it as a present to my 75 year old, young!, mother for she had already told me sheâ€™d like to fly on a plane, before being too late in life, to meet a different culture. There were some limitations though: both canÂ´t stand extreme heat, partly because of our low blood pressure; she has a spine condition that prevents her from walking more than 10 m (very slowly) without making a break. So I looked for some cool Northern European spot not further away than a two hour flight. Amsterdam would please us too because of what weâ€™d watched on TV or read about. An historical city of which we loved the canal house architecture, flat for easy walking, monuments and museums for us to visit, and also the paradise of bikes, which as far as Iâ€™m concerned is the cherry on the top of the cake - Iâ€™m a town biker in a Portuguese flat town by the sea. After choosing the dates and having bought the boarding passes I had a hard mission: Find the right hotel, amongst hundreds in Amsterdam. As my mother and I love them canal houses we had to be staying in one of them! On Trip Advisor I knew about the hotel Misc, its â€œcentrumâ€� location and its very nice hosts Rachel and Pepijn. The reviews were appalling! Finally I asked about the high stairs of this 17th year old building and Rachel chose a room with not many stairs to climb. That was it! Rachel and Pepijn are so friendly and welcoming than even an old lady who doesnâ€™t speak English like my mother felt like home there. They even woke us up at 4 am to be early at the airport on departure : ). A week has passed since we last were there and every sign of happy holidays still lies on our minds. We were delighted with everything, from the cleanliness of the room, to the healthy and fresh breakfasts, facilities in the room, advice and directions of the hosts. the windows that isolated completed from noise â€“ though we liked the liveliness of the location - next to the gorgeous Nieuwmarkt Square, Amsterdamer â€œfietsbellsâ€�and church bells, ethnic kaleidoscope motion, â€œmultichromaticâ€� views, verbalization and laughters. Itâ€™s not an expensive hotel for such amenities. Itâ€™s HIGHLY recommended : ). Wish to come back in February, maybe to this â€œWondersâ€� room..

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay anywhere else, except Hotel Misc Eat-Drink-Sleep”
Reviews.Author: TavsAustralia
Reviews.Content: Booked this Hotel due to great reviews on Trip Advisor. Hate to state the obvious - but it's all true, every word of praise is utterly correct and well deserved. I checked availability over the internet, but saw I had to apparently book for 3 nights. I only wanted 2, so I emailed the hotel, and they were great and said 2 nights would be fine. Rachel & Pepijn are wonderful, genuine hosts and friendly, funny, warm company. We could only stay for a short time, but will go back for sure. They were helpful with maps, eating and drinking 'secrets' - which proved most enjoyable. Apart from enjoying yourself completely - one tip is - if you are leaving by taxi in the morning, settle the bill the day before. The street outside is narrow and when the taxi pulls up, it can block the road, so be ready to leave when you say you will. By the way, the taxi rate from Hotel Misc to the airport is a set rate (it was EURO 37.50), and is much cheaper than the taxi meter actually showed (about EURO 45.00), so you are getting a good deal!! We would recommend this Hotel to anyone we know, as well as complete strangers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, quirky room and wonderful, friendly hosts”
Reviews.Author: Kevin_and_Marisa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a really enjoyable week in Amsterdam staying at this hotel. We found the welcome from Rachel and Pepijn - from when we first walked in through the front door until the goodbye as we left a week later - absolutely wonderful. Rachel and Pepijn could not be more helpful and saved us from wasting our time - from suggesting restaurants, excursions and places to see - on a number of occasions. They really seemed to care that we would have the best time possible. We are very positive travellers, so maybe that helps? The location is quite fine and being close to the Red Light district is absolutely no problem. Just follow the usual rules - walk on well-lit and busy roads - and you'll be fine. It is very central and walking around Amsterdam is just a delight, anyway, and no where is too far as long as you are based in the older part of town, which misc is. Our room was the top floor facing the canal - loved it. Very interesting decoration and what an outlook. There was insignificant noise from the street so no issues there. The breakfast was lovely and I find it amazing that someone could criticise it and felt it was delivered late or slowly. We had no problem at all with the food or the service and all was served with such charm. My wife and I have been very lucky to travel all around the world and have stayed in many types of hotel. I would have no hesitation in highly recommending this excellent hotel and would certainly stay there again when we return to Amsterdam. Kevin and Marisa from Sydney

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Ltava
Reviews.Content: Based on Trip Advisor rating and positive overviews we expected somewhat different accommodation and service. Some more details: 1) the hotel is located in a tourist area (noisy and rather dirty) 2) the room is shabby with broken furniture and faucets 3) free mini bar does not include even beer (only water and juices) 4) the hotel is positioned as a boutique/design hotel. It does not clear to which style and which way 5) advices given by staff were not so helpful (just taken from tourist information directories) 6) breakfast was not ready by 9 as was stated and we had to wait for over 15 minutes to receive at least tea and coffee. All the tables were unmade. Definitely not the best choice to stay in Amsterdam for this price. Before we stayed at Roemur hotel and Tulipa and they are much better.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure why this hotel has been so well rated in Trip Advisor”
Reviews.Author: acukiert
Reviews.Content: We read many excelent reviews on this hotel and chose it based on them. Somehow, I do not feel these reviews were compatible with what we saw. This hotel is situated at the edge of the Red Light District and near an Asian neighborhood. Althouh I did not feel unsafe there, that was certainly not a quiet place, with people partying until late morning every day; noise could be heard even with the windows closed and the help of a noise disguiser provided by the hotel itself. The neighborhood is poorly kept and unclean. From the infrastructure perspective, possibly the worse thing was the absence of air conditioning (only a ceiling vent), which is a major problem during summer time (as far as you can not open the windows due to the street noise). The hole building would deserve a full restauration. This was the first time that we chose a place with so many reviews and got disappointed (will have to pay more attention to details next time...).

Reviews.Title: “My kind of place...”
Reviews.Author: rjmachin
Reviews.Content: The worst thing about misc eatdrinksleep? That name - which makes it sound like some kind of capsule hotel or backpacker hostel, rather than what it is - a wonderfully individual, romantic hotel right in the centre of Amsterdam. Rooms are delightful, individually decorated and overlooking either canal or garden. All are equipped with good coffeemaker, toiletries, robes, big comfortable bed, good lighting and a gratis minibar - no alcohol (a small bar downstairs provides that) but chocolate, snacks and soft drinks, all included in the room price - a first for me, but typical of the way the place is run. The owners are friendly and extremely helpful without being in any way overpowering - all in all the place is a perfect example of what 'customer focus' should really mean (and very rarely does). Downsides? Some people might find the canalside rooms a little noisy - if so, then ask for a garden room. And the stairs are very steep and narrow, but this is a traditional Amsterdam house and that's the way they work. I can't comment on the breakfast as I was leaving too early in the morning, but if the plate of fruit, bread and local cheese that was left in my room was any guide, I'm guessing it would be better than acceptable. Getting here from the airport - unless you're laden down with luggage, don't waste money on a taxi. Fast train is 20 minutes and a few euros, the walk from Dam Square to the hotel is interesting and takes between 10 and 15 minutes. Note that although the hotel is on the edge of the red light area, you need never know it, and the Niewmarket square which it sits on is great for a couple of beers and a spot of peoplewatching. Plenty of cafes and restaurants around too.

Reviews.Title: “Like having your own little romantic hideaway on a canal”
Reviews.Author: StephenRutenberg
Reviews.Content: Love this little hotel and would certainly recommend it for anyone looking for a small hideaway. As soon as we got there we felt part of the city and had a great stay. Great couple run the place. They can arrange a cannel boat ride and are extremely helpful for local info (including coffee houses) . Free mini-bar and breakfast in the room for our early departure were extra special nice touches. Only suggestion would be to get bicycles. Note that this hotel is not for the "old at heart" who need to take an elevator to their room.

Reviews.Title: “...too easy...”
Reviews.Author: d16rr702
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel in a fantastic city. Took a taxi from the airport for about 40 Euro.No cheap but soooo easy. Read the other reviews - right on target!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Little Hotel In Great location”
Reviews.Author: WMBD
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 20 -23 April this year and could not have wished for anything better. We had a large, clean quiet room at the back with a comfortable bed and nice bathroom. The tea/coffee machine and complimentary snacks were welcome and the breakfast was excellent and made to order. The owners were friendly and hospitable and made some excellent recommendations to us including a private boat trip on the canals (arranged by them) and a great Indonesian restaurant for dinner one night. The location is super and we felt very safe. We walked there from Amsterdam Central station in about 10 minutes. We would recommend this hotel to anyone and will definitely stay here again next time in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: avalonbride36
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable stay here on a recent trip. We especially enjoyed Rachel's hospitality. The stairs were steep but manageable and the room was small but nice and had everything we needed. We especially appreciate the complementary drinks and snacks provided in the room. The bathroom was roomy and shower good, although I would suggest replacing the shower curtain with doors. Breakfast was nice and I especially appreciate having an egg made to order. The location was very good - on the outer edge of the red light district, near a lot of sights but on a quiet street so we felt very safe. And you can't beat the short walk to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect little haven - fantastic location & amazing hostess”
Reviews.Author: ScaryCanary
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic little place and I can only echo all the great things that have been said before. It is a small unassuming-looking hotel (we walked past it the first time too!) but inside it is great. The rooms are amazing - as it wasn't too busy, we were allowed to choose which room we wanted out of 3 - we chose the Rembrandt room and it was lovely being surrounded by all those great masters! The room was not huge, but perfectly big enough with all the facilities you'd expect (and more - a fridge packed with chocolates and soft drinks for free!). Rachel was a lovely hostess - friendly, helpful but not over the top. Breakfast was low key and informal but tasty (fresh eggs and lovely yummy cheeses). For a central location so close to the red light district, this was surprisingly quiet and non-mainstream - its just a lovely quirky hotel and I'd recommend it wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “a new favourite hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: spare_lass
Reviews.Content: From our (slightly early) arrival, Rachel and Pepijn couldn't have been more welcoming and helpful. We had the first floor 'Design' room, facing out over the canal, which was clean, light, spacious, and very comfortable (a huuuge bed!) There was an expresso machine and a mini fridge stuffed full of entirely gratis drinks and snacks (juices, water, soda, chocolate, crisps). To my amazement, this was topped up during our stay! There was also a white noise machine, something I've not encountered before and perhaps it might be useful for some guests, but we never found the street/canal noise disturbing and didn't use it. I'd have preferred something to plug my ipod into to play music, but maybe that's just me! The hotel location is perfect for exploring central Amsterdam on foot, with many attractions only a short walk away. And Rachel and Pepijn were a constant source of useful local information and ideas if we were struggling. Breakfast was freshly prepared, delicious and plentiful, and its certainly a big plus that they serve it until midday. We took full advantage of this, not by having long lie-ins (there's too much to do!) but by browsing the local flea markets and then returning for breakfast at around 11. Rachel and Pepijn were fabulous hosts, and nothing was too much trouble. Our occasional problems with the key card became a running joke, and they both demonstrated their humour and patience with us in this regard! This is a great, friendly, informal, comfortable and well designed modern hotel, and I hope to return there again one day.

Reviews.Title: “cannot find a fault”
Reviews.Author: munsterman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in Feb 09 for a three day short break in aMSTERDAM. The hotel got in touch before hand to make sure we had sufficient information to make it from the airport to the hotel and we walked with ease from the Central Staion to the hotle in a matter of minutes thanks for their excellent directions. Location is very central and despite its apparent proximity to the red light district, this does not impinge on your stay and it feels very safe at any hour. Plenty of bars and restaurants within walking distance. We stayed in the first room at the top of a rather steep stairs. It was a nice sized room for an old building. The shower was great and the bed very comfortable. There was no street noise of note and certainly none to keep us awake. I was particularly impressed with the fridge (complimentary soft drinks) and the coffee maker. Breakfast was more than adequate and was available cooked or continental as per your preferance. The hostess was friendly and helpful and courteous. Overall, I would stay here again without hesitation. Outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent location and unrivaled hospitality”
Reviews.Author: annettemg
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the reviews given by others on tripadvisor and I was not disappointed. The hotel is located overlooking one of the many canals of Amsterdam and next to Nieuwmarkt square which hosts a small market every Saturday. Calling Hotel Misc a hotel is a little bit generous considering its size and number of rooms (6). Infact due to the narrowness of the building we walked past it twice before finally seeing it! However, that is not to say the size of the rooms was affected by this. We stayed in one of the cheaper, and apparently smaller garden view rooms, The Retro room. The bed was huge but even still there was plenty of room around and at the bottom of the bed. The en-suite bathroom was also a good size. Due to renovation work being carried out in the dining area on the second day of our stay, we also had the liberty of seeing one of the canal view rooms which had been temporarily converted to a breakfast room. This room ( I think it was The Design room) was also of a good size and nicely decorated. The mini bar was a very welcome addition to the room and was restocked daily free of charge. A very nice touch I thought. Towels were changed daily and toiletries replenished. The shower was one of the best I've ever come across in hotel accomodation, very powerful and never a shortage of hot water which can be a problem later in the evening in some hotels. The only flaws I found with the room wes the thick layer of dust that was clearly visible on the screen of the television. I also have a huge dislike of shower curtains and felt that a shower screen could just as easily have been installed. Breakfasts consisted of muesli's, fruit, cold meats, cheeses, croissants and bacon and eggs served to your liking by Rachel and were very tasty. Rachel was an excellent hosts and upon our arrival presented us with a map and gave us an idea of the scale of the city. This was very helpful. It was the little touches like this that made our stay enjoyable. I would give this hotel 5/5 except for the fact that we were not informed that the aforementioned renovations would be ongoing during our stay. Being woken by drilling and hammering at 8:30 every morning rarely adds to a holiday. We felt that we should have been offered a slightly reduced rate due to this inconvenience especially when we had not be forewarned of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful hosts”
Reviews.Author: van21_sg
Reviews.Content: Lovely boutique hotel situated right in the heart of Amsterdam within a 15-20 minute walking distance from most places in city. Unless you want to venture out of the city centre, there is no need to spend money on the trams or buses at all! Rooms are slightly small but very comfortable. We stayed in a canal facing room which had a nice view. Loved the super yummy breakfast. The owners, Rachel and Pepijn, were really friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel Misc”
Reviews.Author: visitorfromoz
Reviews.Content: We had 3 nights in Amsterdam for some rest after a long stretch of business travel. Hotel Mis was the perfect 'home away from home'!! Rachel & Pipijn's never ending enthusiasm & knowledge about Amsterdam added considerably to our stay and they really are the most thoughtful hosts who will offer you excellent local insight. Our room featured a glorious view over the canal, was cosy & included thoughtful touches that really added to our comfort. The location of the hotel is fabulously convenient to pretty much anything in Amsterdam. Amongst the highlights you can expect .. an excellent breakfast individually prepared and served until a very civilised midday! Soft, fluffy towels, heavenly pillows & quality linens. Super coffee both from the kitchen & in the rooms. Thoroughly engaging hosts!! We will definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelLouLondon
Reviews.Content: Really lovely boutique hotel in every sense of the word. Amazing hospitality and great central location. Tempted not to leave a review as we wanted to keep it a secret! Room we stayed in was thoughtfully and tastefully decorated and excellent value. Breakfast was abundant, delicious and thankfully available till 12 noon!! Would deffinitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality at its best”
Reviews.Author: exploradora2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Misc for one week this past summer and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. Here are some of the highlights of Hotel Misc: - the location is perfect. You can easily get to most places in the city within 20 minutes by walking and/or public transportation. The neighborhood around the hotel also has much to offer. - Rachel and Pepijn. As other reviewers have pointed out, they are phenomenal. They go the extra mile to ensure that your stay at their hotel, and in Amsterdam, is enjoyable, comfortable, and interesting. - the breakfast and mini-bar. Rachel and Pepijn offer a very generous, very delicious breakfast that is included in the cost of the room. The mini-bar is also included and has excellent an excellent selection - all natural smoothies, fair trade chocolate, great chips, the list goes on. There is also coffee and tea (good coffee and tea, at that!) in the room. - the rooms are uniquely decorated, clean, and comfortable. I loved the pillows. The shower is also great. - WiFi access. Always a perk for us internet junkies. I will definitely visit Hotel Misc again when I am in Amsterdam. It was worth every penny. The owners/hosts are wonderful and I love supporting a local business. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great start to our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: bestservedhot
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Misc for one night on our way to our honeymoon. Even though we arrived quite late, Pepijn had arranged for a taxi to pick us up at the airport and we were offered a brief tour of the city before checking in at the hotel. We stayed in the room called Wonders which has an Asian feel to it and was perfect to set the mood for our future travel. As it was late, Pepijn recommended us a tapas place but unfortunately the place was closed. Not to worry though, there are hundreds of eateries and restaurants close to the hotel and we sampled some Argentinian cuisine, was gorgeous. Anyway, back in the room we found plenty of free refreshments in the mini bar and a bottle of bubbly was waiting for us! The following day, Rachel treated us to an amazing breakfast. Over all this hotel does not look like much but it is all the personal touches brought by Rachel and Pepijn that made our stay so special.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: EndUser99
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in the "Wonders" room. Great little hotel, with modern/design oriented decor (one of the owners, Rachel, is in architecture school). Very clean. Fantasic location, 10 min walk to central train station. Only one street away from red-light district (don't be concerned, it is very safe there -and a nice neighborhood, lots of shops and good restraunts). Free WiFi. Great home-cooked breakfast. Best of all was the staff, helpful with directions and tips for places to go! I would stay here again if I come back to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Still a superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: stevieboyUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed again at the Misc as we loved it so much last year - and it did not dissapoint. We stayed in the Design room again which we love. Rachel and Pepjin were as before, such great hosts. I was staying for my birthday and was made to feel very special by them. A great breakfast anytime from 9 - Noon (and you are sitting in the kitchen/diner whilst it is cooked for you) set us up for the day and the complimentary mini bar helped with the munchies!!! There really is little I can add to what has already been said. It is in such a central, yet beautiful part of Amsterdam. Just a 10 minute walk from the station. We have yet to ride a tram in Amsterdam as eveything is so easy to walk too from here. The furthest we walked was the Van Goch musuem which in itself is a great walk. A fab, friendly, clean, relaxing, modern, personal, boutique hotel in the centre of town. Who could wish for more - we will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding experience, feeling better than home...”
Reviews.Author: fwtis
Reviews.Content: The experience of staying at the Hotel Misc cannot be adequately described with words - it has to be lived in order to be evaluated properly. However, I will try to describe our experience with words, mainly because by doing so I will re-live the experience and all the beautiful feelings associated with it... Having been in Amsterdam before, it took me a long research to find the perfect hotel for my wedding trip. Deciding factors were: location, reviews and communication with the hotel. The hotel scored excellent in all areas. So, after seeing the pictures and considering my options, I decided to book the Rembrandt room, since both me and my wife love art, and the museums would be one of our major sightseeings during our trip. First, the location of the hotel is perfect - right in the middle of the city's center, just 5 minutes from practically everywhere: the Dam square, the Central Station, the Koningsplein & the Flower Market, the Rembrandtplein, the Waterlooplein, or even the Leidseplein and the Jordaan if you're like us and don't mind walking a bit more to get where you want. Even if you don't like walking, the hotel is next to the Nieuwmarkt, which means there's a taxi stand right across the street, to make up for the loss of a nearby tram stop. And for those who feel a little uncomfortable with staying at the edge of the Red Light District, it doesn't feel like that at all. You should be able to forget you're near the RLD just by using your common sense, like you would do in any big city. The hotel itself has only one drawback - the steep stairs. But of course this is Amsterdam, stairs are steep by default, and it's really not that bad once you get the hang of it. Other than that, our room was much more beautiful and convenient than I expected it to be, with fresh flowers on the table and a lovely view over the canal, a fridge with snacks & soft drinks, all toilet/bathroom necessities and the most comfortable double bed I've ever slept on. Each day we had a delicious late breakfast, and while we were out exploring the city, our room was cleaned/restocked for the day. Communication with Rachel and Pepjin couldn't have been better, from the beginning of the booking until the end of our trip. They both went out of their way to, not only accomodate us, but help us with everything we possibly needed, from providing & helping us customize boat tours, to offering us a laptop to use with the hotel's wireless Internet connection. It is because of their help & understanding that the surprise I planned for my wife was a huge success, and it is because of their hospitality that we will both remember this trip for the rest of our lives. Thank you Rachel & Pepjin for all the things you did for us and for all the trouble you went into helping us live a wonderful experience. We'll see you again in Amsterdam, hopefully sooner than we think ;)

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite AMS hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chach
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at 5 hotels in AMS now and I'm pretty sure that this is my favorite. The hotel feels very much like a B&B. The owners are super friendly and helpful. The offer lots of cozy touches that make the hotel very charming. Our room had a ton of closet and sitting space. The views over the canal were fantastic. I loved the shampoo/soap/etc that they provided. Smelled fantastic. We had champagne and homemade chocolate pastry upon arrival! Breakfast was pretty standard. Very tasty. Location is GREAT. Close to shopping, food, entertainment and Central Station.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RWTK
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel in the centre of Amsterdam. My wife and I stayed in one of the smaller rooms at the book of the building but there was plenty of room for two far-from-light travellers. The location is perfect, within walking distance of almost everything without feeling seedy due to the close proximity of the red light district. Our room was very clean and nicely furnished. What really made the trip special however was Rachel and Pepijn (the owners) who were fantastic. The breakfast they prepare is wonderful (we tended to eat late and get by with a light lunch) and they went to great lengths to find restaurants for us â€“ take their advice, every recommendation turned out to be a good one. Also, if you have the chance to go on a canal trip, it is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: Fifteena
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful, my husband and I stayed there last night and absolutely loved it. They were told it was our honeymoon and sent up a bottle of champagne then when we came back from our evening out there was a piece of chocolate cake... it was like every time we left we came back to a sweet little surprise. The owners were a very sweet couple. A full breakfast was provided and the fridge in our room was stocked with complimentary drinks. Everything was clean and the white bed linens were beautiful and comfortable. Overall it was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “All the great reviews are absolutely true!”
Reviews.Author: EuroReisen
Reviews.Content: I chose Hotel Misc based on all the great reviews here, and it absolutely lived up to my (high) expectations. As others have mentioned, what makes this place so special are its owners, Rachel and Pepijn. They are friendly without being intrusive, incredibly helpful, and seemed genuinely interested in the goings-on and satisfaction of their guests. The breakfast they provided was fantastic: bread, meat, cheese, an egg cooked to order with bacon, and fresh baked croissants, not to mention cappucino, latte or any other kind of coffee, teas, and fresh squeezed orange juice. It all kept me going well into the afternoon. The hotel itself is well-situated in Amsterdam, within walking distance of most attractions. I was a bit apprehensive about its proximity to the Red Light District, but it was not an issue at all. My room was comfortable and bright, and the free mini-bar was an extra-special treat, stocked each day with sweet and savory snacks, fruit juices, sodas and water. I hope I have reason to return to Amsterdam and stay at Hotel Misc again! It's a very special place.

Reviews.Title: “The "Misc" made Amsterdam Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: HappyChandler
Reviews.Content: I used TripAdvisor extensively when planning our vacation to Amsterdam. In the end, we ended up staying at the Misc, arriving May 1st among the fallout from the Queens Brithday celebration the night before. This was the final stop after seeing 2 other European cities. While I wouldn't characterize Amsterdam as the easiest place to navigate, the Misc's location just off Nieuwmarkt gave us a great landmark to navigate towards. The location was a great home base for our walking expeditions through the city. We were never bothered by its proxiemety to the Red Light District. In the end, we weren't struck so much by the size or quality of the room itself, but were absolutly delighted with the Misc because of the amount of attention and interaction with had with our hosts there, Rachel and Pepijn. From the quality of the food they prepared, to the conversations that gave us real insight into Dutch culture, to the restaurant and beer recommendations they gave, to a very special boat charter, they definately went out of their way to distinguish their hotel as a unique experience. We could not believe how willing they were to go out of their way for us. Looking back , we agree that we got so much more out of Amsterdam because of our choice to stay at the Misc.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Great, Great”
Reviews.Author: LuvSLO
Reviews.Content: Fabulously located, the Hotel Misc is a must stay if you're in Amsterdam. The owners run a top quality establishment. It's a very private small hotel/b&b. The breakfast is incredibly good and filling. Rachel, the owner, cooks a made to order fresh egg and bacon for you in the morning. There is also fresh squeezed oj which was my personal favorite, a selection of jams, cheeses, breads, fruit, teas and fresh baked croissants! It's fantastic. Every room has a mini fridge that is FREE and restocked every day with goodies like soda and brownies, so you can eat like you're on vacation. The hotel is well located and within walking distance to every major site. Although you have to enjoy walking because some sites are not right around the corner. The rooms are great, although more because of their unique furnishings than anything else. Each room has a different theme which is fun. We stayed in the baroque room which was large and quiet because it was at the back of the house. The bathroom was large, had great toiletries and the bed were SO comfortable. I highly recommend this place and would go back if we returned to Amsterdam. One word of caution, there are steep stairs up to the rooms, so if you can not walk well, this property would present some problems.

Reviews.Title: “Best Small Hotel Anywhere”
Reviews.Author: Dr._Bob_4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the MISC hotel in Amsterdam for 4 days in March along with my wife. I can simply say that it is the best small hotel we have ever stayed in. The hostess Rachel is from American and her husband is from Holland, so they are a perfect pair for American visitors. They were also unusually attentive to all of their guests â€“they even made breakfast for us before the usual opening time so that we could eat before cathing an early plane home.â€”and are very knowledgeable about Amsterdam. The nice touches and amenities were almost too numerous to mention. They included free snacks, soft drinks, and mineral water in the room, a cooked to order breakfast served until noon, with great bread and pastries, umbrellas for the rainy March weather, and even a very friendly cat. The location of the hotel is great-right on a canal and walking distance of the train station, Dam square, and the museums and other sites. Our room was small, but very neat and quiet. The room was also a good value for the money, although somewhat expensive for Americans due to the low value of the dollar. If only they could do something about the rainy Spring weather!

Reviews.Title: “Made me want to run my own boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: McBee
Reviews.Content: I almost don't want to wax lyrical about the Hotel Misc (since there are only 6 rooms and I'd like to be able to get one of them next time I go back!) but it really is an absolute treat and I can't fault Rachel and Pepijn's conscientious devotion to running the place. Most of the other reviews cover why this is such a rare and terrific find:- individually themed rooms with canal or courtyard views, free and restocked daily minibar with soft drinks, chocolate and savoury snacks (don't worry though - you can still get a beer or a glass of wine from the lobby!), fantastic location, incredible and laid back breakfasts (Pepijn's homemade Seville orange marmalade is outstanding) etc etc. But for me it was really the comfortable feeling you get - it is like staying with friends, but ones who don't intrude and let you get on with whatever you want to do. Rachel was incredibly helpful with anything we asked about from public transport and directions, to restaurant advice (we were there for 3 days and took every one of Rachel and Pepijn's recommendations - all very different experiences and all faultless). There is no price you can put on this personal touch and it made a hard work business trip feel very easy and relaxing. You'll need to book in advance though - we tried to rebook for 3 days in April and it's full. Which is just what I was afraid of with all these glowing reviews!

Reviews.Title: “Good things in small packages”
Reviews.Author: omelas
Reviews.Content: As someone who had sworn off B&B's (as a small 6-room hotel qualifies in the U.S.) because of the lack of privacy and extremely intrusive hosts, I took a chance on Hotel Misc and was so wonderfully rewarded. I looked at the site and saw the rooms and it looked modern and cool- and very notable - no page with pictures of the host and describing what they are all about. Enough about complaining about the problems with most B&Bs, this hotel was amazing. We'd stayed several times in the Jordaan district at the Canal House several years back and this was much smaller and had a very different feel. Each of the six rooms have a different themes, but they all were very clean and modern. I think the back top floor one might be more traditional. The lobby was a long narrow area with benches and a bar that i assume was used in the summer (we were often one of two rooms used in late Feb) Past a sliding yellow metal door, there was an extremely steep spiral staircase in front of us-as per usual. Fortunately our room was on that floor. I had requested the back and smaller room 1- because it was cheaper, 2 â€“ they had cooler dÃ©cor â€“ and 3) I thought it would be more quiet overlooking an empty courtyard. I was happy to see we were given the â€œWondersâ€� room that evoked a lush middle eastern feel. It was small, but had very cool lighting and fabrics over the bed. The bathroom was a manageable size with no shelf toilet, fancy toiletries and a rain head shower â€“ a welcomed change from being forced in the past to use the handheld sprayer and desperately try to keep the water in the tub or shower, and usually failing. The real selling point of this hotel, however, was the full FREE minibar and Nespresso Maker. It also had a safe underneath the refrigerator. I was under the impression it was filled once during your stay, but any time we opted to have our room cleaned, it was refilled with sodas like sprite and fanta and coke light, of course in .22Litre glass bottles. Also a Toblerone bar, a Snickers bar, pretzel sticks, etc. For our Nespresso maker, we had three varieties of pods with pre-packed espresso grinds and teeny little espresso and cappuccino mugs and tea glasses with tea, glasses, and teeny spoons. The breakfast the next morning was exceptional - there are only spaces for perhaps four couples in the small area next to the sizable professional kitchen. As later risers, we were grateful that it went until noon. Upon arrival (at no pre-designated time- yet another non-b&b plus) we were greeted pleasantly by Rachel who we finally concluded was American. Friendly without imposing, she asked if we wanted espresso or cappuccino (BEST EVER!) and were given breads, handmade jams, fresh squeezed orange juice - done right then for your glass, yogurt, muesli, ham and three cheeses sliced on your own personal plate and then was asked if you wanted freshly baked croissants and or eggs with a thin bacon. Dramatic fresh flowers and kiwis were next to us most mornings. We never felt obligated to chat with Rachel, but we wanted to because she was so interesting but never offered up information we didn't ask. She never made us feel like we were putting her out, that we had to tell her what we were doing that day, but was ready for any questions about places to go. Her partner, a polite Dutch man, loved giving restaurant recommendations. Be wary if you ask for traditional Dutch, though, and know ahead of time what you are in for! We spent the last four nights in the top front room - we were offered a free upgrade since we were staying so many nights and there was only one other room used that week. We were also given a sound machine to block out the street noise. The African styled room had amazing canal views and was much larger. All in all this is one of the most enjoyable stays we have ever had anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: tayloia
Reviews.Content: If you want to spend a few days in Amsterdam without the hassle of getting around by public transport, Hotel Misc is a jewel. The central location is great, the hosts welcoming, the rooms suitably quirky and the breakfasts sublime. Yes, the stairs are steep and the hotel is on the edge of the red light district, but this *is* Amsterdam, so you should feel short-changed if they weren't. We stayed in the Wonders Room (overlooking the small, rear courtyard) which was more than large enough (the en-suite in particular) and quiet. The free non-alcoholic minibar, coffee/tea maker and capacious safe (presumably in every room) are good touches, but nothing compared to the breakfasts (9am to noon): enough to keep you going until the evening. Then the hotel's location really shines; it's ideal for heading out into the under-explored eastern parts of the city centre for dinner and drinks alongside the locals. Although officially the facilities are only two-star, it really *does* feel like you're staying a few days with Pepijn and Rachel; a genuinely five-star experience. P.S. Did we mention the breakfasts?

Reviews.Title: “A little gem!”
Reviews.Author: OntarioEmma
Reviews.Content: I used the feed back on this site to choose a place to stay in Amsterdam, and was not disappointed. My husband and I stayed at Misc for two nights, mid Feb.'08. What a little gem this place is. We arrived very early in the morning, and our room was not ready, so they put us in another one (Design) so we could rest up a bit. This is at the front of the building overlooking the canal. Was very impressed. The breakfast was excellent. Yes, you get fresh juice, eggs, cheeses, meats, coffee, bread, but Rachel's homemade spiced rhubarb jam was simply...heaven! While we were out exploring, they kindly moved our things to the room we had booked(Wonders) which is at the back, overlooking a really sweet garden courtyard. It was a very comfortable room, had all the amenities of a small hotel, and a good sized bathroom to boot! Misc definitley has location, location. It's about a 10 min. walk from the train station, and we did not need to take public transport at all. We walked every where. While we took the train in from the airport and walked to Misc on our arrival, we choose to take a taxi back to the airport for our departure because it was really, really, early. When it didn't arrive as planned we simply called Pepijn, and it was there in 10 mins. Rachel and Pepijn are excellent hosts and do their very best to make sure you enjoy your time at their place. Amsterdam is a wonderful city, and Misc is just the place to stay and enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “Woooow what a good choice”
Reviews.Author: greg_the_traveller
Reviews.Content: After checking several hotels at tripadvisor we choose this place. And I can only say that we have made the right choice. Rooms are clean, quite spacious and very nice decorated we had a canal view roon (Design). Breakfast was a lot, BUT GOOOOD, croissant, yoghurt, eggs, bacon, fruit, fabulous FRESH orange juice etc. and from 9 to 12 an extra bonus. Pepijn and Rachel are excellent hosts and they reccomended us some excellent restaurants. Overall we loved our stay here and we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world!”
Reviews.Author: CarlosRaurell
Reviews.Content: I have never had a better hotel stay than I had at the Hotel Misc over Thanksgiving Weekend, 2007. It was nothing short of spectacular. My travel mate, Allison, and I stayed in the Rembrant Room, which overlooks the lovely Kloveniersburgwal canal -- right in the heart of the city. The room was spacious, clean and charmingly decorated with beautiful wooden furniture and framed Rembrant and Vermeer prints on the walls. It was quiet, save for the church bells ringing periodically in the distance. The room was perfect for resting or reading by the large windows after a busy day of sightseeing. It instantly felt like home. My favorite part of our stay was definitely the superb breakfast lovingly prepared for us each morning. In addition to freshly baked breads, homemade jams, fresh fruit, coffee and tea, guests are treated to an assortment of excellent cheeses and ham. Bacon and free-range eggs are made to order and served with the flakiest, most buttery croussants imaginable. Oh, and I forgot to mention the freshly squeezed orange juice. It was the perfect way to start the day -- truly heavenly. The minibar in our room was tuly complimentary. The delicious goodies inside (chocolates, cookies, sodas, water, potato chips) were restocked daily and, best of all, included in the cost of the room! I could not believe it. The minibar was very much appreciated when the late night munchies struck (a very common occurrance in Amsterdam)! The best part of our stay, however, had to be the warmth and hospitality with which we were welcomed by Rachel and Pepin. It is so clear that they love what they do. That love was evident in every aspect of our stay at the Hotel Misc. This was not my last time in Amsterdam, nor will it my last stay at the incredible Hotel MIsc!

Reviews.Title: “Don't delay, book it now!”
Reviews.Author: Mark_n_Dale
Reviews.Content: As others have said, it's all been said before. Myself and my wife were there for our honeymoon, and stayed there for a total of 6 or 7 nights, split up over two weeks as we were using Amsterdam as our 'home base'. Stayed in 4 of the 6 rooms, and they were all very nice, as others have mentioned. Yes, the stairs are steep by North American standards, but if you've been in other old buildings in A'dam then you know they are all like that. Unlike other reviewers, we didn't find the canal view rooms excessively noisy, and the garden view rooms were very peaceful. Rachel and Pepijn were both fantastic hosts, and no request was refused. Breakfast was top quality, with fantastic breads and cheeses etc. The location is one of the highlights; very close to Nieumarket Square, which has some wonderful restaurants and coffee shops. Easy, easy, to get anywhere on foot, or use the very good trolley system. If you are a traveler who enjoys staying in places that give you a local flavour, as opposed to those that insist on 'the north american experience', then I highly recommend Misc. Mark & Dale

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, excellent hosts”
Reviews.Author: BobbyManchester
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girlfriend stayed here for a long weekend in April and would definitely return. The hotel is in a great spot for exploring Amsterdam on foot (ie tourist spots in the day, bars & restaurants in evening) and is fairly close to the train station - we walked it in about 15 mins or so. If you're flying into Amsterdam I'd definitely take the train to the city rather than a taxi, unless you have loads of luggage. We thought the hotel was very reasonable (compared to other Amsterdam hotel prices). The room was clean, had all the facilities we required and had a nice view of the garden. I would book a room on the front of the hotel in the future (the "retro" room we booked was more "student kitsch" - but was absolutely fine) Breakfast was excellent and we really liked the breakfast space - really friendly and informal. I've saved the best for last though - Pepijn & Rachel are fantastic hosts. I had been in touch with them before we arrived and they provided some really good local knowledge on where best to visit, booked an excellent restaurant for us ("Grietje" I think?), and booked us tickets for a trip to Keukenhof. Overall - loved it and would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Incredible place & people & value”
Reviews.Author: Infinitygirl
Reviews.Content: Again, another more than satisfied customer. One of the best hotel experiences I have had.

HotelInfo.Name: misc eatdrinksleep
HotelInfo.Address: Kloveniersburgwal 20, Amsterdam 1012 CV, The Netherlands (Formerly Zosa Hotel)
